title: Environmental Data Analyst
description:
* Rijswijk, Netherlands
Hanover, Germany
Luton, United Kingdom
Stockholm, Sweden
Brussels, Belgium
* 127865
* Hybrid
* Permanent
* Full Time
* 40
The Environmental Data Analyst will play a crucial role in supporting the airline’s sustainability initiatives. This position involves analysing, working with multiple teams to collate and interpret environmental data related to fuel efficiency, external reporting requirements, and other relevant metrics. The analyst will also contribute to shaping requirements, automating processes, and ensuring compliance with legislative developments.  



In addition, the Environmental Data Analyst will collaborate closely with the Group data and IT teams to manage data and reporting requirement across the entire airline. The primary focus will be on data management and integration, ensuring that multiple data sources are effectively utilised and are future-proofed for environmental reporting and performance management.  



This role will also develop strong stakeholder relationships with teams across TUI Airline, the Group Sustainability team and relevant finance and reporting teams. The role will be responsible for delivering and maintaining robust reporting, analysis and MI, and will be critical in supporting all sustainability activities required to meet ISO 14001 certification, Science Based Target Initiative, as well as other aviation related reporting requirements.  


**\*Applications close on 28t June\***
**\*\* This role can be based in one of our offices in UK , Netherlands, Belgium, Germany or Sweden\*\***
**ABOUT THE ROLE**

  



Given the importance of fuel efficiency within the airline’s sustainability agenda, fuel reporting requirements will form an important part of the role and will require collating, analysing, and reporting of fuel efficiency data across the airline’s operations. It will also include identifying trends, anomalies, and opportunities for improvement such as collaborating with cross-functional teams to communicate optimisation opportunities.
The Environmental Data Analyst will also stay informed regarding multiple external reporting requirements, as well as work with other data teams to prepare accurate and timely reports for regulatory bodies and stakeholders, along with ensuring compliance with environmental disclosure guidelines.
The role will also look to evaluate existing environmental reporting practices and identify gaps in data collection and reporting, as well as propose and implement solutions to enhance data accuracy and completeness. As part of these reporting practices, the role will need to adapt data processes to meet evolving legal requirements. Managing multiple data sources, ensuring data quality and consistency is also key. The Environmental Data Analyst will take an active role in shaping data requirements and will collaborate with TUI Group and Airline teams to develop new tools for data analysis where required including implementing automation solutions.
In addition, the role will monitor industry labelling initiatives related to environmental impact (e.g., carbon labelling), assess the airline’s compliance with labelling standards and collaborate with wider sustainability team for any labelling data practices.  


**ABOUT YOU**

  


* Experience working in a highly regulated environment in an analytical capacity ideally relating to environment management or sustainable development initiatives
* Experience of analysing trends and insights and developing measures for success
* An understanding of the environment field and aviation fuel including relevant sustainable development topics
* A track record of driving continuous improvement through analysis; evidence of having successfully challenged the existing state of affairs, including working robustly with stakeholders to drive change
* Insightful appreciation of the formal and informal influences and structures within an organisation; works effectively to involve stakeholders in business decisions by building trust and gaining consensus with people across all levels of the organisation and across different countries
* Cultural sensitivity, with experience of working as part of a pan-European team
* Able to operate as a trusted partner to multiple source markets, and to influence the application of common solutions and best practice in all airlines
* Strong business English is mandatory and fluency in other European languages an advantage

  


**ABOUT OUR OFFER**  


* Working in the leading global tourism group: We stand for intercultural cooperation and offer the opportunity to work in international projects and teams.
* Mobile working, flexible working hours and working from abroad: We believe that work is something you do, not where you go.
* Development and career opportunities: We promote the potential of our employees with a wide range of (digital) training opportunities and international career opportunities.
* Personal benefits: We offer attractive remuneration, generous travel benefits, extensive health & wellbeing offers and much more.

  



We love to see your uniqueness shine through and inspire the future of travel. If you would like to read more about what Diversity & Inclusion means to us simply visit Our DNA  


If you require any further information regarding this opportunity, please email careers@tui.co.uk

We really value your interest in TUI and will be back in touch with you shortly after the application closing date.

title: Risk Analist
description:
Amersfoort


HBO/WO


36 - 40 uur


Banking & Finance


Ben jij gek op data en wil je graag jouw analytische vaardigheden inzetten en ontwikkelen? Sluit je aan bij ons Risk Management team!

 **Risk model developer (junior)**

**Wat ga je doen als Risk Analist?**


Bij het Risk team van VWPFS krijg je een breed scala aan boeiende taken, die flexibel in te delen zijn op basis van jouw skills en passie. Je kunt bijvoorbeeld aan de slag met het ontwikkelen en valideren van statistische modellen (zoals PD, LGD). Of je kunt de acceptatiecriteria voor leasing en financieren verbeteren, een ESG-risicomodel implementeren, of helpen met geavanceerde fraude-analyses.

  

Je houdt van leuke data-uitdagingen en wil graag waarde toevoegen aan de business. Je werkt gestructureerd en streeft naar een efficiënt en transparant proces. Je gebruikt hiervoor je skills in bijvoorbeeld R, Python, SQL of vergelijkbare tools, of je kunt je hier snel in ontwikkelen. Je kunt je bevindingen op een intuïtieve manier visualiseren (bijvoorbeeld in Qlik) en presenteren aan het management. Daarnaast vertegenwoordig je Risk in verschillende IT-projecten. Dit gevarieerde takenpakket vraagt om sterke analytische vaardigheden en het vermogen om te schakelen tussen verschillende taken. Je deelt proactief jouw bevindingen binnen het team en met de business, en grijpt kansen tot verbetering met beide handen aan.

 **Wat vinden wij belangrijk?**


Wij hechten veel waarde aan samenwerken vanuit een growth mindset. Met enthousiasme duik je in analyses en help je elkaar, terwijl je van elkaar leert. Je komt terecht in een hecht team van 7 Risk-professionals met uiteenlopende ervaring en specialisaties, zoals risk, kredietanalyse en fraudepreventie. Het actief opzoeken van samenwerking en kennisdeling binnen de afdeling is voor ons essentieel. Je hebt een hands-on mentaliteit en een passie voor data en analyse.

**Wat verwachten wij van jou als Risk Analist?**


We zoeken een enthousiaste en zelfstandige Risk Model Developer; Je bent in staat om verbanden te leggen en jouw bevindingen helder en eenvoudig te communiceren naar je collega’s. Jouw kerncompetenties zijn analyseren en interpreteren!

  

* Je hebt een afgeronde master econometrie, (bedrijfs)economie of een gerelateerde (kwantitatieve) studie
* Starter of enige werkervaring
* Passie voor data
* Sterke analytische en conceptuele skills
* Basisvaardigheden in R / Python / SQL of vergelijkbaar
* Affiniteit met IT (datawarehouse)
* Enige werkervaring binnen Risk, Controlling of Finance is een pré.
* Je communiceert vloeiend in zowel Nederlands als Engels

**Wat mag jij van ons verwachten?**

* Een uitdagende baan met fijne collega’s
* Naast een goed basissalaris extra individueel keuzebudget tussen 19,65% en 20,48% van je bruto maandsalaris
* 25 vrije dagen en de mogelijkheid om maximaal 15 dagen bij te kopen van jouw individueel keuzebudget
* Hybride werken; een gezonde mix tussen thuis werken en op kantoor
* €900 om jouw thuiswerkplek in te richten via de thuiswerkwinkel van VWPFS
* Reiskostenvergoeding én thuiswerkvergoeding
* Events en uitjes om jouw collega’s nog beter te leren kennen
* Een divers trainingsaanbod, zowel fysiek als online
* De ruimte om je te ontwikkelen in de richting die bij jou past!

**Over Volkswagen Pon Financial Services**


Volkswagen Pon Financial Services is een joint venture van Volkswagen Financial Services AG (gelieerd aan Volkswagen AG) en Pon Holdings. We financieren, leasen en verzekeren niet alleen de mooiste automerken, maar bieden financiële oplossingen voor elke vorm van mobiliteit. Dat doen we voor autodealers, wagenparkbeheerders, midden- en kleinbedrijf en particulieren. Hierin is geen vraag ons te gek en geen oplossing te vergezocht. Onze medewerkers geven elke dag het uiterste om de flexibele, betrouwbare en professionele partner voor onze klanten te zijn. Daar krijgen we energie van en zijn wij trots op! In 2022, 2023 en 2024 zijn wij gecertificeerd als Great Place to Work. Wil je alvast een beeld krijgen van waar je gaat werken?


Zin om aan de slag te gaan en ben je van mening dat jij bij ons past?

*Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.*

title: Data Analyst
description:
**Role: Data Analyst**  
**Location:Amersfoort**  
**Language: Dutch**

**Description:**  
This is what you're going to do    
Our team has a lot of knowledge around data platform engineering, but no expertise in building data products such as dashboards in Tableau. Your job is to take our data products to the next level. You will be given a lot of freedom and end-to-end responsibility, where your own ideas and input are certainly welcome. In addition, you are also the first user of our self-service data platform and you contribute ideas about the proper implementation of self-service services. It is important that you can work independently and proactively, are comfortable in a team that is mainly technically oriented and are interested in learning new technical skills.

* You design, build and maintain dashboards and reports.
* You set up new data models and optimize existing models.
* You seek out stakeholders for input on requirements and feedback.
* You ensure good documentation of our data products.
* You contribute ideas about the proper functioning of our self-service services.
* You take ownership of the data products and guarantee quality.

**You will take this with you further** 

* You have at least 3 years of work experience with tableau.
* Extensive experience with SQL and setting up and optimizing data models for reporting purposes.
* Knowledge of Python, Snowflake, dbt and Airflow is an advantage.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* A proactive attitude to learning and development, with a willingness to explore and embrace new technologies and methodologies.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to work effectively in a dynamic environment.
* An independent and proactive working attitude.

Job Type: Full-time

title: Business Analyst
description:
**Company Description** **Who we are?**


JDE Peet’s is the world's leading pure-play coffee and tea company, with local roots dating back to 1753, and is headquartered in the Netherlands. We unleash the possibilities of coffee and tea in more than 100 countries with a portfolio of over 50 brands, including L’OR, Peet’s, Jacobs, Senseo, Tassimo, Douwe Egberts, OldTown, Super, Pickwick and Moccona.

**What’s it like to work at JDE Peet’s?**


We are people united by the power and possibility of tea and coffee. At JDE Peet’s, we thrive on the freedom to pursue opportunities, provoking new ideas to make an impact at scale. Our ambition is simple – JDE Peet's: unleashing the possibilities of coffee and tea.


We bring action to our intentions, following through on what was agreed, always pushing things forward. We offer our people a range of learning and development programmes to support their personal growth. We’ve worked hard to build an open, collaborative environment where you can approach anyone and be heard.


At JDE Peet's, we believe it’s amazing what can happen over a cup of coffee or tea. We also believe that a diverse and inclusive culture enables us to serve every coffee and tea lover in the best possible way. No matter who you are, where you come from, how you live your life, or how you enjoy your coffee or tea, you can fulfil your ambitions and contribute to our success.

**When you grow, we grow, and coffee & tea grows.**

**UNLEASH YOUR POSSIBILITY!**

Find out more at https://careers-ihq.jdepeets.com/I-Hybrid

 **Job Description** ***Coffee Solutions is JDE Peet’s dedicated out of home business, delivering great coffee experiences to more than 80.000 B2B customers across 8 markets in West & Northern Europe.***

***As the central Business Analyst for Coffee Solutions you will be the driving force pushing for data-driven decision making by the Coffee Solutions Leadership Team,*** ***whilst proactively flagging opportunities for business improvement in different areas of our business. To be successful in this role, you are not only a knowledgeable analytics professional, but you are also strong in connecting with both local and central teams and stakeholders in our Coffee Solutions business. We count on your mindset to create value and your get-up & go attitude to make impact in our value chain.***

***In this role you get to work in the central Coffee Solutions team and will report into the Finance Director Coffee Solutions.***

**Responsibilities**

* ***Monthly (KPI) reporting & analysis***
* ***Structural & ad hoc analysis to identify and provide visibility on business opportunities***
* ***Support central & local Coffee Solutions teams establishing comprehensive business cases***
* ***Build & maintain the Coffee Solutions Analytics Community***
* ***Be the source of information & data insights for several departments and markets***

  

  

**Qualifications** ***We are looking for a self-starting, proactive pioneer with a drive for excellence, not only good at connecting the dots, but also good at connecting with people. Someone that holds themselves accountable and does not shy away from responsibility. Given the nature of the role, we feel it is important for you to have a certain level of experience as well as a solid understanding of your own added value. We thrive in diverse teams and look for people that appreciate that as much as we do. We can give you a list of “must haves,” however that’s not how we view your candidacy. We do, of course, take into consideration your analytical skills and how much experience you have with successfully translating data into insights and actions, but ultimately, we look at the bigger picture. To give you a bit of guidance as to what we feel is needed in this role, we’ll share our “nice to have” list with you:***

* ***High autonomy, structured approach to work, proactive and problem-solving attitude***
* ***Excellent analytical skills and ability to translate data into insights into recommendations & actions that create value.***
* ***Strong business acumen and ability to connect the dots. Understanding the business processes and their performance drivers (operational & financial)***
* ***Solid understanding of multiple source data and analytical platforms (e.g. SAP Hana/BW, PowerBI, AlteryX, Excel)***
* ***Compelling stakeholder management and communication skills (in English)***
* ***Passion for technology, data and learning new systems on the fly***
* ***3-5 years of experience in business analytics, working with both systems and people***

 **Additional Information** **Your application at JDE Peet's** **:**

  

**If you are interested in this career opportunity at JDE Peet's, apply and join us. After receiving your application we will do our utmost to give you quick feedback. Part of the recruitment procedure at JDE Peet's would be an online assessment, followed by interviews. A pre-employment check can be part of the recruitment process.**

*The future of work is hybrid, with both office and home playing an important role. At JDE Peet's, we value meeting colleagues in the office to unleash the possibilities of coffee and tea together and we enjoy our focus time when working from home. Join us and you will experience both. Because it’s amazing what happens over a cup of coffee.*

***Whether or not you are with us, two, four or thirty years, it doesn’t matter. We help you build your skillsets and potential career. We offer a solid and competitive base salary and ad additional benefits to the mix. To name a few: Learning and development budget, career development, Insurances, pension plans and a minimum of 25 + ADV days paid holidays (because we care and want to offer you a healthy work – life balance)***

*#unleashyourpossibility #acupofamazing* #LI-Hybrid

title: Financial Reporting Analyst
description:
**Who is Infinitas Learning?**



Infinitas Learning is a dynamic educational resources company, and one of Europe's leading providers of innovative and engaging products and services for teaching and learning. At Infinitas we are passionate about transforming the way people learn. We aim to deliver flexible, market-leading solutions that support new approaches to learning for the 21st century. The Infinitas Learning group includes Liber (Sweden), Noordhoff (The Netherlands), Plantyn (Belgium) and Leya (Portugal) as well as Infinitas Product & Technology (The Netherlands). The group employs around 600 people and is headquartered in Utrecht (The Netherlands).

 **The role**



Are you an analytical talent with a passion for data and affinity with financial reporting?



As a Financial Reporting Analyst at Infinitas Learning, you will be part of a centralized Data & Insights team. Our role as the central team is to identify business problems worth solving, that need solving, and tackle them by utilizing, combining, and analyzing existing source data from systems such as Netsuite and SAP BPC. This enables the business and customers to make better (data-driven) decisions more quickly and with greater confidence. We operate across a broad variety of domains such as finance, operations, commercial, learning didactics, and platform usage.

  

As a Financial Reporting Analyst, you will focus on turning financial data into valuable insights and reports for different stakeholders within Infinitas. Focus is on reports like the Income Statement, Balance Sheet, Cash flow and all kind of reports related to the order and sales process. With your expertise in data and finance you will manage various initiatives, ensuring the delivery of project milestones within the agreed timeframe and quality standards.

 **What you will do**


* Design, build and deliver accurate and fast analytical reporting and dashboards using Microsoft Power BI fed from the data marts
* You will test and ensure the data quality and documentation of financial data products that our team creates and ensure uniformity and consistency across reports.
* Work closely with various stakeholders within the financial domain to identify areas where Data & Insights can be used to improve business processes and operation.
* You are able to act as a sparring partner for the finance team and are excellent at reconciling data with financials from source systems such as Netsuite and SAP BPC
* Utilize a strong business acumen to identify and develop analytical use-cases with high value together with various stakeholders within the financial domain.
* Ensure optimal performance to maximize the use of the Power BI functionality. Excel in designing data models to best practices including use of complex DAX-calculations, making use of conformed dimensions and striving to push business logic to the data marts.
* Work in close cooperation with Analytical Engineers to give feedback regarding necessary design changes on data models and missing data.
* Communicate, document, and present the use of our analytical tools to peers and different stakeholders throughout the organization.
* Constantly stay up to date on new technologies in the analytical reporting, dashboards, and visualization space and where they may fit our initiatives.

 **Who you are**


* Enjoy working in a fast-paced environment handling multiple activities simultaneously. Exercise business judgment and make sound decisions under pressure.
* Take initiative, are transparent, and deliver high-quality results. We take it for granted that you are responsible, and solutions oriented.
* An analytical, innovative, and structured problem solver with a passion to make data analysis a business asset by enabling value.
* Keen interest in improving financial reporting
* Recognize the importance of working as one team and can identify and develop talent. You thrive when developing people, not just products. Giving and receiving feedback is a natural part of your everyday work.
* Appreciate working with international colleagues and distributed teams.
* A curious and life-long learner with a keen interest in the evolution of analytical reporting and visualization techniques.


**What experience you must have to qualify as a candidate**

  

* Bachelor’s degree in either Data Analytics, Business Analytics, Data Science or Computer Science with a strong financial related component or a Bachelor’s degree in Accountancy, or Business Economics with a strong data component.
* Minimum of 2 years of experience in data analytics and/or financial reporting: maintenance and support of analytical financial reports and dashboards.
* Designed, developed, tested, and supported analytical reporting and dashboards using Power BI. Experience programming in complex DAX calculations.
* Excellent English written and oral communication skills.
* Fluent in Dutch or Swedish is preferred.
* Working permit within the European Union.
* Can work regularly at one of our office locations Antwerpen/Stockholm/Utrecht/Groningen

 **What Infinitas Learning offers you**

  


* Competitive salary.
* Attractive and flexible employment conditions.
* Flexible working hours depending on team requirements as to how, where, and when you work.
* A job with a real purpose where you really contribute to society.

  

Applications are being reviewed on an ongoing basis. In case of any questions please feel free to reach out to Casper Fransz.
  

Please apply via https://careers.infinitaslearning.com. Applications via LinkedIn, direct messages, or mail will not be reviewed.

title: Financial Analyst
description:
**All Posting Locations:** Utrecht, Utrecht, NL
**Job Functions:** Finance
**Date Published:** May 24, 2024
**Ref#:** R-80655
  

ABOUT THE ROLE
Job Description
**About the Position**


**Financial analyst**


We have an excellent opportunity available within Manufacturing finance to make a difference at Kraft Heinz. The Financial Analyst position lies within the Utrecht factory. You’ll be reporting into Site Controller of Factory. The delivery of accurate and on-time reports for financial planning, analysis and control activities for the factory will be your primary responsibility.


We are looking for a self-starter, eager to learn with a hands-on mentality. Apart from the actual, forecast and budget routines your main goal is to improve factory performance and deliver support on all finance topics. You feel a high responsibility in driving results and deliver targets. To be successful in this position you need to be analytical, accurate and able to motivate others.


**Main Responsibilities**


* Coordinating and delivering period-end closing in SAP and preparing review of actual results vs budget, forecast, prior year etc
* Forecasting and budget activities and related reports and analyses aligned with factory operational functions to manage accuracy
* Ensure complete and timely management reports for performance measurements against operational KPIs and financial objectives
* Analyzing past results, performing variance analysis, identifying trends, and making recommendations for improvements
* Analyzing financial data and creating financial models for decision support
* Consolidate the information for the open POs together with Accounts Payable team and coordinate required actions with site functions
* Be the point of contact within the site considering materials and vendor set up, PO and vendor reconciliation
* Take the initiative to drive improvements and efficiencies in working methods and reporting structures within the site and with central office
* Provide decision support regarding cost prices and improving the quality/accuracy of cost prices in the system
* Set up and maintain SAP master data impacting standard costing
* Ensuring compliance with internal and external accounting standards and regulations (including SOX)

**Profile**


**Experience and Education**


* Bachelor's degree in business economics or related master’s degree
* 2-3 years of professional experience in financial analysis or business control, preferably in a factory environment
* Knowledge of accounting is a plus
* Experience in SAP Finance and Controlling modules is an advantage
* Strong MS Office with advanced Excel skills
* Professional English skills, speaking Dutch or willingness to learn is an advantage

**Competencies**


* Strong analytical skills to translate complex data into clear overviews to drive improvements.
* Attention to detail and accuracy in work combined with full view on the final results.
* Skilled in planning and prioritization. Be able to work under pressure and deliver within tight deadlines.
* Curiousity and proactiveness in problem solving.
* Strong communication skills and team player.

Location(s)
Utrecht

  



**Kraft Heinz is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Underrepresented Ethnic Minority Groups/Women/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity and other protected classes****.**


  
ABOUT US
Kraft Heinz is a global food company with a delicious heritage. Our emerging and iconic food and beverage brands deliver the best taste, fun, and quality to every table we touch. Worldwide.


We’re on a mission to disrupt not only our own business, but the global food industry. Consumer obsession and unexpected partnerships fuel our progress. As we drive innovation company-wide.


Our people are connected by a culture of ownership, agility and endless curiosity. We believe in being good humans — working to improve our company, communities, and planet.


We’re proud of where we’ve been and even more thrilled about where we’re headed as we nourish the world and lead the future of food.


WHY US
We grow our people to grow our business. We champion great people who bring ambition, curiosity, and high performance to the table as the guardians of our iconic and nostalgic brands.


Good isn’t good enough. We choose greatness every day by making bold decisions and challenging what’s ordinary. All while celebrating our wins – and failures – as we work together to transform the future of food.


GROW YOUR FULL  

POTENTIAL
Be ambitious. Aim high. Lead like the owner of our business. Realize your passions and purpose, here at Kraft Heinz.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Data Analyst


Information Technology
Utrecht
Full-time
Netherlands
Vacatureomschrijving


Ben jij een data wizard met een passie voor het ontrafelen van complexe datasets?  

  

We zijn op zoek naar een gedreven Data Analyst die ons Customer Experience team komt versterken! Als Data Analyst ben je onderdeel van een team van toegewijde professionals die een passie hebben voor het bieden van een onvergetelijke klantbeleving. Samen met je team til je de klantbeleving naar nieuwe hoogten door middel van data gedreven inzichten en continue proces- en performance verbeteringen. In deze rol zul je ondersteuning bieden bij een breed scala aan data analyses, waarbij je grote hoeveelheden interne en externe data gebruikt om inzichten te genereren en customer experience te verbeteren.  

  

De afdeling Customer Experience (CEX) is verantwoordelijk voor de correcte end-to-end afhandeling van klantvragen en verzoeken, en voor het beheren en verwerken van de klantcontracten in het systeem. Daarnaast vallen NPS en Customer Engagement onder onze verantwoordelijkheid.


Jouw verantwoordelijkheden:

* Het opstellen van dashboards op basis van interne en externe data;
* Het identificeren, initiëren en leiden van het verbeteren van de processen binnen de unit en stakeholders;
* Het uitvoeren en presenteren van zowel terugkerende standaardanalyses, als ad-hoc onderzoeken om de tevredenheid van klanten te meten en te kijken waar verbeteringen in onze systemen kunnen plaatsvinden;
* Fungeren als een pionier binnen het CEX team;
* Correct en efficiënt gebruik maken van beschikbare dashboards en tools voor zelfstandige data-analyses;
* Het eerste aanspreekpunt zijn binnen het team voor vragen met betrekking tot data, rapportage en tools, waarbij je proactief oplossingen biedt en kennis deelt.


Functie-eisen


Heb jij een ondernemende instelling en krijg jij energie van het behalen van successen? Dan pas jij goed bij JDE. Onze medewerkers inspireren al meer dan 270 jaar de internationale koffiewereld. Wij houden van mensen die niet bang zijn om uit te proberen en die dat doen tot het goed gaat. Wij hechten waarde aan een sterke overtuiging en moedigen je aan je mening te geven. En dat allemaal in een open en toegankelijke omgeving waar jij kan groeien zoals jij dat wilt.  

  

Voor de positie Data Analyst zoeken we iemand met de volgende vaardigheden en ervaring:

* Een afgerond opleiding op hbo of wo niveau
* Minimaal 2 jaar werkervaring in een soortgelijke functie
* Vloeiende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal in woord en schrift
* Ervaring met data-analyse en relevante tooling (Salesforce, Power BI, Apptus)
* Analytisch en commercieel
* Je krijgt energie van het aanzetten tot veranderingen die bijdragen aan een betere Customer Experience!


Aanvullende informatie


Het is verrassend wat er allemaal kan gebeuren door een kopje koffie. Bij Jacobs Douwe Egberts, hebben we er onze missie van gemaakt om dit uit te zoeken. Als projectleider kan jij impact maken door hier onderdeel van te zijn. Onze mensen zijn hier sinds dag een mee bezig en we zijn er dan ook trots op dat we samen iedere dag een rol mogen spelen in de levens van miljoenen mensen met onder andere onze sterke merken als Douwe Egberts, L’OR, SENSEO®, Pickwick, Piazza D’Oro, Jacobs, Tassimo, Moccona, Kenco, Pilao en Gevali. Ons koffie- en theeportfolio is verkrijgbaar in meer dan 100 landen. We geloven er in dat iedereen de koffie verdient waar hij of zij zo van houdt, wie je ook bent, waar je ook woont of hoe je het drinkt! Kortom: “A coffee for every cup”.  

  

Jacobs Douwe Egberts (JDE) Professional levert koffie- en theeconcepten aan kantoren, overheidsinstellingen, horeca en hospitality, kortom alle instellingen buiten het supermarktkanaal. Vanuit onze ondernemerschap, kennis en rijke traditie zijn wij een strategische partner voor onze klanten en denken wij op creatieve en innovatieve wijze met hen mee over unieke koffie- en theeconcepten. Op deze manier leveren we bij verschillende klanten een bijdrage aan hun doelstellingen op gebied van duurzaam ondernemen en medewerkerstevredenheid.  

  

**Arbeidsvoorwaarden**  

Als je bij ons werkt, maak je impact in een dynamische en ambitieuze omgeving. We werken als team, vieren successen en steunen elkaar. Onze medewerkers werken met een diversiteit aan gelijkgestemde collega’s in een innovatieve omgeving. Iedereen is erop gericht om te doen wat juist is – overal ter wereld. Wat je hier doet, wordt opgemerkt.  

Bij JDE krijg je een goed salaris en een uitgebreid pakket aan arbeidsvoorwaarden passend bij deze rol, waaronder:

* 25 vakantiedagen én 12 ADV dagen;
* Een salaris van min € 4.098 en max € 6.595 bruto per maand o.b.v. 40 uur;
* Goede pensioenregeling;
* Korting op de producten van JDE;
* Volledige OV-vergoeding van en naar je werk;


Voor ons maakt het niet uit wie je bent, waar je vandaan komt, hoe je je leven leidt of hoe je je koffie drinkt. Wij vinden het belangrijk dat JDE een organisatie is waar iedereen kan bijdragen, groeien en ontwikkelen. Elk land, iedere cultuur en elk individu heeft een uniek verhaal waar we naar luisteren. Door met diverse collega’s samen te werken binnen een inclusieve cultuur lukt het ons iedereen welkom te heten in de wereld van koffie en thee.  

  

Ben je geïnteresseerd in deze vacature, dan kun je jouw motivatiebrief richten aan Anouk van der Schaar, Talent Acquisition Specialist.


Je kunt voor de vacature tot **30 juni 2024.**  

De eerste gesprekken vinden plaats in de eerste week van juli.  

De tweede gesprekken vinden plaats in de tweede week van juli.  

  

Intern noemen we deze functie: Performance Improvement Analyst.


Een online assessment en een Pre-Employment Screening maken onderdeel uit van de procedure.

title: Data analist economische effecten energietransitie
description:
**Over deze vacature**
----------------------


Als scientist bij de afdeling energy transition studies (ETS) in Amsterdam werk je nauw samen met toegewijde professionals aan onderzoeksprojecten en beleidsvraagstukken gericht op de energietransitie.
**Wat ga je doen?**
-------------------


Jij bent verantwoordelijk voor het verzamelen en analyseren van data. Deze gegevens vormen de basis voor ons beleids- en onderzoeksprojecten. Je voert econometrische analyses uit op de verzamelde informatie en draagt bij aan de gesprekken met belanghebbende partijen. Daarnaast werk je intensief samen met zowel interne als externe collega's om nieuwe kennis te ontwikkelen en innovatieve rekenmodellen te creëren, gebaseerd op recente wetenschappelijke inzichten. Je draagt ook bij aan het schrijven van beleidsrelevante en wetenschappelijke publicaties, waardoor je een directe impact hebt op beleidsdiscussies en de wetenschappelijke gemeenschap.  

  

Wil je meer weten over het werk van de afdeling ETS? Klik hier
(opent in nieuw venster) (verwijst naar een andere website)
 voor meer informatie.
**Wat wij van jou verwachten**
------------------------------


Vanzelfsprekend ben je geïnteresserd in de economische aspecten van de energietransitie Je hebt affiniteit met het uitvoeren van diepgaande kwantitatieve analyses met betrekking tot de impact van de energietransitie op huishoudens, bedrijven en productieve sectoren, theoretische en praktische vragen over (energie)rechtvaardigheid, en hoe de voordelen en kosten van de transitie en het beleid om deze mogelijk te maken, over de samenleving worden verdeeld.  

  

Daarnaast vind je het leuk om te communiceren met vakgenoten, óók met andere disciplines (technici, modelleurs, et cetera). Je bent in staat zelfstandig onderzoekstaken op te pakken en werkt graag in teamverband. Je zoekt dwarsverbanden tussen thema’s als duurzame energieopwek en energiearmoede en weet dit in nieuwe onderzoeksprojecten te realiseren.  

  

Wat je verder meebrengt:
* Een masteropleiding in economie of econometrie.
* Je bent bekend met programmeertalen zoals R en Python.
* Je hebt affiniteit met kwantitatieve analyse.
* Ervaring met beleidsvraagstukken en de energietransitie is een pre.
* Wetenschappelijke publicaties zijn een pre.

Ben je klaar om je passie voor energie en onderzoek in te zetten voor een duurzamere toekomst? Sluit je dan aan bij ons team bij TNO en help ons de energietransitie vorm te geven.


**Wat wij jou bieden**
----------------------


Uitdagend én afwisselend werk met serieuze impact. En volop kansen, want bij TNO heb je grotendeels zelf de regie over je carrière. Naast een bruto (fulltime) maandsalaris tussen € 3.300,- en € 3.950,- (afhankelijk van je kennis en ervaring), vakantiegeld (8%), een dertiende maand (8,33%) en een flexbudget (5,58% + €180), krijg je alle mogelijkheden om jezelf te ontwikkelen. Misschien wil je doorgroeien in de richting commercie of consultancy. Of wil je projectmanager worden, jezelf meer verdiepen in duurzame innovaties of carrière maken als technisch expert.  

  

Daarnaast kun je bij TNO een ‘menu’ aan arbeidsvoorwaarden samenstellen dat bij jouw persoonlijke situatie past. Wat je ook mag verwachten:
* Een uiterst professionele, innovatieve werkomgeving, met topexperts als collega’s.
* Mogelijkheid om cursussen, opleidingen en workshops te volgen en congressen te bezoeken, en coaching als je daar behoefte aan hebt.
* 33 vakantiedagen (bij een fulltime dienstverband).
* Een werkgever die divers talent waardeert en stimuleert, met initiatieven als het Female Leadership Programma, onze Rainbow Community en round tables over inclusiethema’s.
* Een uitgebreide en flexibele mobiliteitsregeling, inclusief volledige vergoeding van openbaar vervoer voor woon-werk en zakelijke reizen.
* Gezellige activiteiten met je team en andere TNO'ers. Zo leer je snel veel mensen kennen.
* Flexibele werktijden, de mogelijkheid om parttime (32 of 36 uur) te werken en de mogelijkheid om thuis te werken.
* Toegang tot ons Talent Development Programme.
* Netwerkmogelijkheden en leuke activiteiten georganiseerd door Jong TNO.
* Uitgebreid verhuispakket voor internationale sollicitanten.
Een goede pensioenregeling.  
* 

  

Lees hier uit welke arbeidsvoorwaarden je verder kunt kiezen.


**TNO als werkgever**
---------------------


Bij TNO innoveren we voor een gezonder, veiliger en duurzamer leven. En voor een sterke economie. Sinds 1932 ontwikkelen wij kennis en technologie voor het algemeen belang. We vinden elkaar in verwondering en vindingrijkheid, en we zijn gedreven om grenzen te verleggen. Voor jouw talent en ambitie is er alle ruimte en ondersteuning. Je werkt samen met mensen die aan je gewaagd zijn, die jou inspireren én van jou willen leren. Onze state-of-the-art-faciliteiten zijn er om jouw visie te verwezenlijken. Wat je bij TNO doet, doet ertoe: impact maakt het verschil. Want met elke innovatie draag je bij aan het leven van morgen. Lees meer over TNO als werkgever.  

  

Bij TNO stimuleren we een inclusieve werkomgeving, waar jij jezelf kunt zijn. Wat je verhaal ook is en welke unieke eigenschappen je ook meebrengt. Juist door onze unieke krachten en perspectieven te bundelen zijn we in staat om innovaties te ontwikkelen die een wezenlijk verschil maken in de samenleving. Meer weten? Lees welke stappen wij zetten op het gebied van diversiteit en inclusie.
**Hoe ziet het proces eruit?**
------------------------------


Reageren kan tot en met 14 juli. De sollicitatieprocedure bestaat uit twee gespreksrondes. De eerste ronde staat gepland op 23 juli. De tweede ronde staat gepland op 30 juli. In een laatste gesprek bespreken we de arbeidsvoorwaarden die je zelf samenstelt. We streven ernaar de hele procedure binnen vier weken af te ronden.  

  

Een online assessment en referentiecheck kunnen onderdeel uitmaken van de selectieprocedure.  

  

Als je bij ons komt werken vragen wij je ook een Verklaring Omtrent het Gedrag (VOG) te overleggen.
company_addresses:
Anna van Buerenplein 1
2595 DA Den Haag
company_description: TNO, as a trusted, independent, and pioneering applied science and technology organisation, plays a multifaceted role.

title: Global Senior Analyst - Sales Capabilities Training & Deployment
description:
**All Posting Locations:** Amsterdam, Noord Holland, NL
**Job Functions:** Sales
**Date Published:** April 26, 2024
**Ref#:** R-81924
  

ABOUT THE ROLE
Job Description
**About the Role:**


Kraft Heinz is seeking a passionate and articulate individual to join our team as a Global Manager, Sales Capabilities. In this position, you will play a pivotal role in developing and delivering impactful training programs for our global salesforce, ensuring successful adoption of new sales tools and processes, and driving improved sales performance across our diverse product portfolio. The Perfect Path To Purchase (PP2P) is a key priority for the company and guiding our global sales organization towards implementing the ideal customer journey across all touchpoints is critical.


**Responsibilities:**


* Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams at Kraft Heinz, including Sales, Capabilities, Category & Marketing, to gain a deep understanding of sales challenges, opportunities, identify purchase journey pain points and develop new sales capabilities and solutions for seamless and efficient interactions.
* Develop and maintain strong relationships with key partners and vendors to stay up to date on industry best practices and innovative solutions in the PP2P landscape.
* Design and develop Sales Capabilities Agenda based on local market’s needs – meaning engaging and effective training programs tailored for diverse global markets, considering cultural nuances and regional differences in sales environments and consumer preferences. These initiatives will notably optimize the customer journey across all channels, including online and offline touchpoints.
* Review and Select best External Vendors that can best support driving and building the sales capabilities programs – including set up of pilots to review feedback from local teams.
* Manage external vendors and subject matter experts to craft compelling training materials, including presentations, case studies, and online learning modules, specifically relevant to Kraft Heinz products and sales strategies.
* Facilitate training sessions and workshops for global sales teams, delivering content in an engaging and informative manner that fosters knowledge retention and application.
* Coach and engage regional sales managers and Local Champions on effectively delivering training programs aligned with Kraft Heinz's specific sales methodologies and best practices, as well as implementing new ways of working with customers.
* Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of training programs – notably in the effectiveness of PP2P efforts – through data analysis and feedback collection, identifying areas for improvement and ensuring continuous program optimization.
* Partner with the Learning & Development team at Kraft Heinz to ensure alignment of training programs with broader organizational goals and strategic initiatives.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration and alignment of PP2P initiatives across the organization.
* Stay up-to-date on industry best practices in training methodologies, adult learning principles, and the evolving landscape of the food and beverage industry – including cutting-edge solutions in the PP2P landscape.

**Qualifications**


***Please kindly note that you need to have an EU Working Permit (Orientation Year Visa not included) in order to proceed for this position.***


* Experience in sales
* Project Management
* Connect with different stakeholders and areas to guarantee timeline and alignment

**What we offer you**


* An ambitious employer; we only want to the best for you;
* A fast career track like only few other companies can match;
* A competitive salary and excellent bonus structure (above market);
* Reimbursement travel expenses;
* Always room for new ideas; if you have a great idea, please let know, andand we can set it in action!

Kraft Heinz is an Equal Opportunity Employer that prohibits discrimination or harassment of any type. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.


**About Us**


Kraft Heinz is a global food company with a delicious heritage. With iconic and emerging food and beverage brands around the world, we deliver the best taste, fun and quality to every meal table we touch. We’re on a mission to disrupt not only our own business, but the global food industry. A consumer obsession and unexpected partnerships fuel our progress as we drive innovation across every part of our company.


Around the world, our people are connected by a culture of ownership, agility and endless curiosity. We also believe in being good humans, who are working to improve our company, communities, and planet. We’re proud of where we’ve been – and even more thrilled about where we’re headed – as we nourish the world and lead the future of food.


**Why Us**


We grow our people to grow our business! We champion great people who bring ambition, curiosity, and high performance to the table as the guardians of our beloved and nostalgic brands. Good isn't good enough. We choose greatness every day by challenging the ordinary and making bold decisions. All while celebrating our wins – and our failures – as we work together to lead the future of food.


Challenging the status quo takes talent. We invest in your purpose and potential by developing skills and nurturing strengths that leave a legacy on our business and a lasting impact on your career. Because great people make great companies, and we’re growing something great here at Kraft Heinz.


Location(s)
Amsterdam

  



**Kraft Heinz is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Underrepresented Ethnic Minority Groups/Women/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity and other protected classes****.**


SALES AT KRAFT HEINZ


THE  

CONNECTORS

We thrive wherever consumers can meet iconic and innovative brands — in retail, on-trade, and B2B. We’re the closest people to our customers, getting our products to the right people, in the right places.

description:

ABOUT THE ROLE
Job Description
**What do we bring to the table?**

**Senior Analyst, IT- Finance Systems at a glance**

Kraft Heinz is currently hiring a Senior Analyst, IT – Finance Systems to join the Oracle Enterprise Performance Management Team.


As the Senior Analyst, IT – Finance Systems you will partner with the various Finance organizations within Kraft Heinz to build process and technology capabilities that support their growth and strategic agenda. This position will require some but not extensive knowledge of Oracle EPM suite of Modules. They will oversee the month end close process and will be responsible for the requirements, development, and deployment as part of continuous improvements. They should have some knowledge of developing business rules, reports, and automations specifically related to with Oracle epbcs and Oracle data management.

  



**Functions**


* Help with the administration with the Oracle EPM applications.
* Lead month end close process from a system perspective.
* Engage with the business to translate business requirements to technical specifications.
* Will develop and configure the oracle epbcs applications and will include the development using business rules, data management, and other scripting languages (python).
* Provide end user support, troubleshoot issues, and guide users on system capabilities.
* Maintain batch processes for data load and consolidations.
* Track system change requests, maintain system documentation and processes.
* Focus on continuous improvements and process automations.
* Technical knowledge of scripting is required to successfully automate and improve the processes.
* Ensure documentations such as functional designs, requirements, runbooks are up to date.
* Should have an understand database concepts.
* Nice to have, but not limited to languages related to python, window’s PowerShell, and other scripting languages.

**Education and Skills**


* Degree in Information Systems.
* Some knowledge and understanding of the Finance processes for forecast and planning.
* General understanding of Agile Methodologies.
* Experience with Data Integration.
* Working with cross functional teams to resolve complex issues.
* Adheres to deliverables, milestones.
* Has the ability for critical thinking.

**Recipe for Success: now if this sounds like you!**

* I am strong at task management and communication, looking to expand my Project Management Skills
* I have some functional or technical experience with financial consolidation, planning, budgeting or forecasting tools (such as Oracle EPM or similar tools).
* I have knowledge of data management concepts and interested in expanding exposure to automation tools such as EPM Automate
* I am a proficient user of the Microsoft Office tools (Excel, Word, Power Point, Share Point, Teams)
* I have a passion to learn, challenge myself professionally and contribute to team goals
* I feel empowered to fail, learn, and grow with an experimental mindset to drive innovation

**We hope to find you a seat at our table!**

title: Senior Applicatiespecialist Intensieve Geneeskunde
description:
**Over de functie**
-------------------


Als team, de LocalNerds van de IC, zijn wij verantwoordelijk voor de borging, de vernieuwing en de verbetering van de ICT-producten in de ICU specifieke zorgprocessen. We doen dit door, afhankelijk van de situatie, verschillende rollen te vervullen, van informatie-architect en softwareontwikkelaar tot data analist en alles wat daartussen hoort. We zijn dus bezig met de volledige cyclus van de software welke zich niet beperkt tot het ziekenhuisbrede EPD.  

  

Dit past helemaal bij jou:* je bent proactief, klantvriendelijk en ondersteunend
* je ziet kansen tot verbetering, vindt het uitdagend deze te implementeren
* je bent een spin in het web en kartrekker
* je houdt van een diverse baan
* je wilt je graag professioneel verder ontwikkelen


**Werkomgeving**
----------------


Werken bij Intensieve geneeskunde betekent werken in een klein, hecht team, waar kwaliteit van zorg en werkplezier voorop staan. Je komt in een team te werken waarin jij gestimuleerd wordt om initiatief te nemen en door te pakken.  

  

OLVG heeft meerdere locaties. Werken bij OLVG kan dan ook ‘werken op meerdere locaties’ betekenen. We kennen twee hoofdlocaties te weten Oost aan het Oosterpark en West aan de Jan Tooropstraat.


**Functie-eisen**
-----------------


We verleggen de bekende weg als het bijdraagt aan het resultaat. En bedenken het liefst hoe het nóg beter kan. Op eigen wijze en met elkaar. Daarom rekenen we op jouw klantgerichte houding, tact en inlevingsvermogen. Je bent in staat om verbeteringen op prettige wijze te begeleiden en weet als geen ander mensen te begeleiden en motiveren. Dit alles om de best mogelijke zorg te leveren.  

  

Dit neem je mee:* HBO of WO werk- en denkniveau
* werkervaring binnen de ziekenhuis zorg is een pré
* kennis van Epic InPatient is een pré
* kennis van VB.Net en SQL (dan wel de bereidheid deze te ontwikkelen)
* de bereidheid om je verder te verdiepen in de diverse modules van Epic, van het schrijven van M-code en het bouwen van Web services tot het extraheren van de gegevens
* Engelse taal in woord en geschrift


**Wij bieden**
--------------


Werken bij OLVG betekent werken in hét stadsziekenhuis van Amsterdam. Een werkomgeving waar jij je optimaal kunt ontwikkelen. Want jouw wensen en ideeën doen ertoe. Zo doen we dat bij OLVG.  

  

Daarom bieden we jou:* minimaal €3.923,- en maximaal €5.746,- bruto per maand (fulltime) in FWG-schaal 60 cao ziekenhuizen
* de mogelijkheid om, op termijn, de Master Health Informatics te volgen
* de mogelijkheid om een breed scala van Epic certificeringen te behalen
* dienstverband voor de periode van één jaar, met zicht op verlenging voor onbepaalde tijd
* kostendekkende OV-reiskostenvergoeding
* flexibele reiskostenregeling, waarbij jij iedere dag kunt kiezen welk vervoer jou het beste uitkomt
* eindejaarsuitkering van ruim 8%
* vakantiegeld van ruim 8%
* 144 uur vakantieverlof
* persoonlijk levensfasebudget van 57 uur extra verlof en de ruimte om te werken aan jouw eigen ontwikkelingswensen
* pensioenregeling bij PFZW
* voordeel op jouw ziektekostenpremie met onze collectieve ziektekostenverzekering. Kies uit IZZ of Zilveren Kruis Achmea
* kortingen op verzekeringen en financiële diensten van Centraal Beheer Achmea
* korting bij diverse lokale ondernemers, zoals eettentjes, cafés en sportcentra
* onbeperkt toegang tot e-learnings en ons vitaliteitsprogramma
* de keuze in arbeidsvoorwaarden die bij jou passen. Zoals de mogelijkheid om een nieuwe telefoon, fiets of laptop met belastingvoordeel aan te schaffen
* gedeeltelijk thuiswerken behoort tot de mogelijkheden


Deze arbeidsvoorwaarden zijn op basis van een fulltime dienstverband (36 uur per week).

title: Data Analyst
description:
**Language: Dutch**

**Description:**  
This is what you're going to do    
Our team has a lot of knowledge around data platform engineering, but no expertise in building data products such as dashboards in Tableau. Your job is to take our data products to the next level. You will be given a lot of freedom and end-to-end responsibility, where your own ideas and input are certainly welcome. In addition, you are also the first user of our self-service data platform and you contribute ideas about the proper implementation of self-service services. It is important that you can work independently and proactively, are comfortable in a team that is mainly technically oriented and are interested in learning new technical skills.

* You design, build and maintain dashboards and reports.
* You set up new data models and optimize existing models.
* You seek out stakeholders for input on requirements and feedback.
* You ensure good documentation of our data products.
* You contribute ideas about the proper functioning of our self-service services.
* You take ownership of the data products and guarantee quality.

**You will take this with you further** 

* You have at least 3 years of work experience with tableau.
* Extensive experience with SQL and setting up and optimizing data models for reporting purposes.
* Knowledge of Python, Snowflake, dbt and Airflow is an advantage.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* A proactive attitude to learning and development, with a willingness to explore and embrace new technologies and methodologies.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to work effectively in a dynamic environment.
* An independent and proactive working attitude.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Work Location: In person

title: Data Scientist
description:
**ING is looking for a****n Experienced** **Data** **Scientist in the Tribe** **Digital, Assisted Channels & Customer Interactions**
We are looking for an experienced Data Scientist to lead one of our data science initiatives. The ideal candidate brings extensive expertise in statistical modeling, machine learning, and data analytics. In addition to technical proficiency, strong interpersonal skills are a must, as you will collaborate cross-functionally, guide and mentor junior team members, and lead projects from inception to implementation.

 **The team**


At ING, we aim to become the best mobile-led bank on the continent. The Tribe Digital & Customer Interactions drives digital sales and develops digital interactions with customers. With over 70 data analysts and scientists, we accelerate the transition towards becoming a fully data-driven organization. We work in multi-disciplinary teams, allocated as data consultants both internally and externally to our tribe.


At ING we promote diversity and want to make our teams a reflection of our world. If you recognize yourself in the description below, but your profile doesn't match the job description 100%, don't hesitate to apply.

**Roles and responsibilities**


We value innovation and expect you to explore new use cases, contributing to our evolving data-driven strategies. Proficiency in data exploration, visualization, and storytelling is crucial for transforming complex findings into actionable insights for both technical and non-technical stakeholders. If you are a seasoned data scientist with a passion for innovation, ready to drive impactful insights and committed to personal growth, we want you on our team.

**How to succeed**


We hire smart people like you for your potential. Our biggest expectation is that you’ll stay curious. Keep learning. Take on responsibility. In return, we’ll back you to develop into an even more awesome version of yourself.

* An MSc or Ph.D. with excellent academic results in the field of Computer Science, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Statistics, or other quantitative fields.
* 4+ years of relevant and demonstrable experience in the field of data science.
* Both broad and in-depth knowledge of machine Learning techniques: Classification, Regression, Clustering, Text Mining and Deep Learning.
* Experience with programming Languages and tools including Python, PySpark, SQL, Git, Shell.
* Familiarity with cloud platforms, particularly GCP and BigQuery is a plus.
* You embrace writing readable, documented and efficient code.
* You are not afraid to learn new technologies and help work through data engineering partnerships.
* Understanding of model lifecycles and monitoring including developing and bringing models to production.
* Demonstrated experience successfully collaborating in cross-functional teams including business, engineering and data science stakeholders.
* Experience in working in an Agile/Scrum is also a plus.
* You are open to feedback and growth on technical skills, business applications, and soft skills.
* You are fluent in written and spoken English. Dutch is a plus.

**Rewards and benefits**


We want to make sure that it’s possible for you to strike the right balance between your career and your private life. You can find out more about our employment conditions at https://www.ing.jobs/netherlands/Why-ING/benefits.htm


The benefits of working with us at ING include:

* A salary tailored to your qualities and experience
* 24-27 vacation days depending on contract
* Pension scheme
* 13th month salary
* Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary
* 8% Holiday payment
* Hybrid working to blend home working for focus and office working for collaboration and co-creation
* Personal growth and challenging work with endless possibilities
* An informal working environment with innovative colleagues

**About us**


With 60,000 employees and operations in approximately 40 countries, there is no shortage of opportunities for people with initiative who want to help people take a step ahead in life and in business. Do you want to work at the cutting edge of what’s possible and at the same time ensure you work with integrity and hold the customer’s interests at heart? Do you want to be surrounded by progressive, inspiring, diverse and supportive colleagues? Then there is no better place to invest your talents than at ING.  

Join us. Apply today.

 **Questions?**


Contact the recruiter attached to the advertisement for more information. Want to apply directly? Please upload your CV and motivation letter by clicking the “Apply” button.
company_description: With 9 million account holders, ING is one of the largest and most prominent financial service providers in the Netherlands. We are part of ING Group, a global financial institution.

title: Data Analyst Intern
description:
**All Posting Locations:** Nijmegen, Gelderland, NL
**Job Functions:** IT
**Date Published:** April 16, 2024
**Ref#:** R-81492
  

ABOUT THE ROLE
Job Description
Data Analyst Intern
**Start date:** August/September 2024


**Duration:** 5 to 6 months


**Platform/Project:** R&D Digital Transformation


**Location**: Amsterdam


You will be part of an international small team with the ambition to drive digital technology forward for Kraft Heinz R&D International Zone. Expect to be part of the team from day one. Strong learning experience on data visualization with many practical deliverables which will be used directly by the organization.


 Assignments and key activities:


* Support dashboard creation to support day to day work of R&D functions
* Support digital transformation across the R&D team (e.g. communication about changes- identification of digital tools required by R&D team)
* Investigate new tools and trends in Digital world
* Participate & contribute into meetings related to Digital strategy
* Collaboration with Digital Ambassadors

Requirements:


* Having a Business Analytics/Management/Information Technology background
* Data visualization skills (Tableau, Power BI)
* Being comfortable with working with big data
* Having a structured personality with ability to learn fast
* Previous internship with data visualization or experience with data analytics is a plus
* You should have strong communication skills and fluency in English, both written and verbal (Dutch is not a requirement but other languages are a plus)
* You are enrolled at a university for at least 50% study load for the duration of the internship.
* **NOTE: EU working** **rights are required** ***(Either you have EU Citizenship, you are studying in the Netherlands or have relevant student work visa)***

**Recruitment process:**

CV selection based on hard requirements such as EU working rights Online Pymetrics assessment Online Pymetrics video assessment Online Screening Interview via Microsoft Teams Hiring manager interview Amazing internship opportunity that can kickstart your career!


*Note: The recruitment process can take 4/6 weeks in total*


**What we offer you**:


We take interns seriously. You can expect from us to give you 1-on-1 mentorship from one of our experienced colleagues. We will work together on your personal learning goals and are keen to hear all good ideas you have! We will give you the space and support to make mistakes and grow. Become a part of a close intern community as well as a young and ambitious work environment (including online).


As a Kraft Heinz intern you’ll be the owner of your own projects and especially of your own career. At Kraft Heinz, we provide the playing field. You change the game. Are you up for the challenge?


**About Us**


The Kraft Heinz Company is one of the largest food and beverage companies in the world, with eight $1 billion+ brands and global sales of approximately $25 billion. We’re a globally trusted producer of high-quality, great-tasting, and nutritious foods for over 150 years. Our brands are truly global, with products produced and marketed in over 40 countries. These beloved products include condiments and sauces, cheese and dairy, meals, meats, refreshment beverages, coffee, infant and nutrition products, and numerous other grocery products in a portfolio of more than 200 legacy and emerging brands.


We spark joy around mealtime with our iconic brands, including Heinz, Kraft, Bull's-Eye, HP, Lea and Perrins, Quero, ABC, Master, Banquete, Plasmon, Orlando, Benedicta, Honig, Pudliszki, Wattie’s among others.


No matter the brand, we’re united under one vision: *To sustainably grow by delighting more consumers globally*. Bringing this vision to life is our team of 39,000+ food lovers, creative thinkers, and high performers worldwide. Together, we help provide meals to those in need through our global partnership with Rise Against Hunger. We also stand committed to responsible, sustainable practices that extend to every facet of our business, our consumers, and our communities. Every day, we’re transforming the food industry with bold thinking and unprecedented results. If you share our passion – and are ready to create the future, build a legacy, and lead as a global citizen – there’s only one thing to do: join our table and *let’s make life delicious!*


**Our Culture of Ownership, Meritocracy & Collaboration**


We're not afraid to think differently. Embrace new ideas. Dream big. We empower our people at every level – from entry-level intern to senior leader – to own their work. We share a responsibility to think like Owners – to be mindful of the collective and sustained success of Kraft Heinz – which we apply to every situation, every day. As part of Kraft Heinz, you're supported to grow and achieve. You’re expected to bring your authentic self to work every day, to lead with humility, and drive outstanding performance at every level – and you’ll be rewarded. You’re given opportunities to leave a mark and build a legacy. But you won’t do it alone. You’re supported by passionate teammates along the way, and our collective, collaborative spirit fuels our incredible progress.


Location(s)
Nijmegen

  



**Kraft Heinz is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Underrepresented Ethnic Minority Groups/Women/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity and other protected classes****.**


  
ABOUT US
Kraft Heinz is a global food company with a delicious heritage. Our emerging and iconic food and beverage brands deliver the best taste, fun, and quality to every table we touch. Worldwide.


We’re on a mission to disrupt not only our own business, but the global food industry. Consumer obsession and unexpected partnerships fuel our progress. As we drive innovation company-wide.


Our people are connected by a culture of ownership, agility and endless curiosity. We believe in being good humans — working to improve our company, communities, and planet.


We’re proud of where we’ve been and even more thrilled about where we’re headed as we nourish the world and lead the future of food.


WHY US
We grow our people to grow our business. We champion great people who bring ambition, curiosity, and high performance to the table as the guardians of our iconic and nostalgic brands.


Good isn’t good enough. We choose greatness every day by making bold decisions and challenging what’s ordinary. All while celebrating our wins – and failures – as we work together to transform the future of food.


GROW YOUR FULL  

POTENTIAL
Be ambitious. Aim high. Lead like the owner of our business. Realize your passions and purpose, here at Kraft Heinz.
company_description: Challenging the status quo takes talent. So we're growing a global team of food lovers, creative thinkers, and high performers to reimagine the future of food and beverage.

title: Junior Anaplan Consultant - NL
description:
As Junior Anaplan Consultant, your primary role is to translate and configure supply chain planning & business requirements into effective Anaplan models. You work closely with the Anaplan Architect of the project and customer stakeholders, analysts and end-users, to gather their needs to develop the Anaplan solution. You analyse processes and data structures to develop solutions that align with the organization's goals and objectives.


The ideal candidate has reached the Anaplan certification as Model Builder. Excellent communication, problem-solving, and analytical skills are also important for effectively collaborating with stakeholders and delivering successful Anaplan implementations.

 **Responsibilities**


Next to Anaplan modelling and implementation knowledge, responsibilities as Junior Anaplan consultant include :

* Stakeholder engagement and change management
* Data integration to establish connections between Anaplan and various source systems
* Model Performance Optimization
* Organisation of model training and support for customers and Eyeon employees
* Initiate Anaplan innovation in the supply chain domain
* Demo development and organization of POC sessions for customers

  

This position is remote capable, but must remain open to travel to client sites and EyeOn offices, as required.

 **Profile**

The ideal candidate profile would look like:

* Master’s degree in engineering, economics or IT and/or equivalent work experience
* Strong affinity with data and IT.
* Development experience in managing Anaplan technology and SaaS projects is a plus
* Anaplan certification at Model Builder level is a plus
* Experience in supply chain business processes & IT transformation
* Keep track of the latest trends in supply chain planning and have an eye on big data and AI.
* Take pride in being an advocate on behalf of EyeOn to enhance and innovate the Anaplan product to better serve EyeOn’s customers.
* Able to work in a fast-paced, international environment.
* Fluent in English

  

For more information about applying, please contact Bart Geerts at bart.geerts@eyeon.nl or at 06-83340107

title: Business Analist
description:
Binnen De Nederlandsche Bank (DNB) ontwikkelt en onderhoudt het team Statistiek Web Applicatie Team (SWAT) diverse producten waarmee ze hun statistische data op een slimme en aantrekkelijke manier beschikbaar stellen voor zowel interne als externe gebruikers. Het team werkt Agile volgens de Scrum methodiek en DevOps.

### **Jouw Rol**



Als business analist werk je aan drie belangrijke producten:



* **Beheer-app:** Hiermee kunnen statistici datasets en bijbehorende metadata publiceren op de website.


* **Externe API:** Maakt datasets beschikbaar via een API voor externe gebruikers.


* **STAT Winkel:** Biedt dataproducten aan de interne gebruikers.


### **Wat ga je doen?**


* Verzamelen van requirements bij de business en deze vertalen naar user stories.
* Visualiseren en documenteren van bedrijfsprocessen en customer journeys.
* Verdiepen in het business domein, of bereidheid om dit te leren.
* Uitvoeren van functionele en/of acceptatietesten.


Je werkt nauw samen met een team van vijf developers, een solution architect en een product owner. Daarnaast ben je de schakel tussen het publicatieteam en het SWAT DevOps team.

### **Wie zoeken we?**



We zoeken iemand die communicatief sterk is, zelfstandig kan werken, proactief is en bekend is met werken met data.


**Vereiste ervaring:**


* Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring als business analist in een agile omgeving.
* Minimaal 1 jaar ervaring met backlog management in Azure DevOps.
* Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring in een data-intensieve omgeving.


**Gewenste ervaring:**


* Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring in een statistiek omgeving.
* Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring met Microsoft Azure.
* Kennis en ervaring met het analyseren en vormgeven van API’s.
* Minimaal 1 jaar ervaring met functioneel- en/of acceptatietesten.
* Minimaal 1 jaar ervaring met DevOps werken.


**Vereiste kennis/opleiding:**


* Minimaal HBO denk- en werkniveau.
* Goede schriftelijke en mondelinge vaardigheden in het Nederlands.


**Gewenste kennis:**


* Azure Fundamentals.
* Diploma’s/certificaten op het gebied van requirements-analyse.


**Licentie speciale tooling:**


* Je dient in het bezit te zijn van een MSDN enterprise versie.


**Competenties:**  

Deze worden getoetst tijdens het gesprek

  

* Proactief
* Communicatief
* Gestructureerd en nauwkeurig
* Verantwoordelijkheidsgevoel
* Teamspeler
* Resultaatgericht
* Organisatie-sensitief
* Zelfstandig

### **Wat bieden wij?**


* Een contract voor 12 maanden met intentie tot verlenging.
* Een 36-urige werkweek
* Salarisrange € 4.240,00 - € 7.142,11 bruto per maand (afhankelijk van ervaring).
* Pensioenbijdrage en vakantiegeld.
* 13e maand.
* Hybride werken, thuiswerk- en reiskostenvergoeding.
* Flexibele werktijden, waarbij 4x9 mogelijk is.

### **Solliciteren**



Interesse? Solliciteer dan uiterlijk woensdag 19 juni 15:00.

title: Senior Claims Data Analyst
description:
We’re looking for a strategic thinker to join our team as a Senior Claims Data Analyst to support our Customer Operations department. This role supports our EU and US claims and customer service operations and can be based in either the Netherlands or the UK.


As a Senior Claims Data Analyst, you will lead complex projects, extract actionable insights from data, and support financial planning within the claims experience landscape, and more broadly across the Customer Operations organization. This role is perfect for a visionary data strategist who’s passionate about leveraging next-generation technological solutions, optimizing existing processes, and facilitating collaboration across our Product,Claims, Ops, and Data teams. You will report into the centralized Operations enablement group, and work cross functionally with senior stakeholders to drive key initiatives from ideation to completion. You'll play a pivotal role in delivering a superior claims experience, driving operational excellence, profitability, and innovation within our operations.

**What you’ll do**

* Project Leadership: Lead complex projects, aligning them with business goals and maintaining stakeholder relationships.
* Financial Analysis: Support financial strategy through analysis and forecasting, impacting budget and capacity planning.
* Data Analysis & Reporting: Analyze claims data, and transform raw data into actionable insights.
* Claims Support: Identify trends in claims data and support the operational Claims function.
* Business Intelligence: Design reporting systems, improve MI quality, and support strategic decisions.
* Compliance & Improvement: Ensure regulatory compliance, participate in market initiatives, and suggest process improvements.
* Effective Communication: Effectively communicate complex information to a wide audience using Google Presentations and documentation on a regular basis.

**What you’ll need**

* 5+ years in a similar role, within the insurance industry or a comparable regulatory environment.
* Strong project management with a track record of leading complex projects
* Advanced data analysis skills for informed decision-making.
* Exceptional problem-solving, communication, and collaboration skills.
* A willingness to take on additional duties as needed, contributing your unique experiences to help achieve our goals.
