title: Technical Business Analyst
description:
Trivium Packaging is a global sustainability leader in metal packaging with more than 60 locations worldwide, nearly 8,000 employees, and an annual revenue of approximately €3.0 billion. Trivium serves a diverse range of customers in a variety of end markets such as food, seafood, pet food, nutrition, beauty and personal care, household care, and premium beverages.


Trivium wants to shape the industry and has embarked on an ambitious transformation journey. In the near term, focus is on building & upskilling the team, deciding where to play & how to win, and increasing financial performance by executing the Trivium Business System (commercial, operational, and supply chain excellence). Sustainability is embedded in our materials and in our actions. Trivium has ambitious sustainability targets and focuses exclusively on products that are infinitely recyclable. Our company sustainability journey has been awarded with a Platinum medal by EcoVadis, the world’s leading rating agent who allocated this award only to the top 1% of the >75000 companies reviewed. Sustainability is embedded in each and every function at Trivium, it‘s in our DNA. The global head office is at Amsterdam Airport; however, many people work in virtual teams from different countries. Our culture is results-driven, entrepreneurial, informal, and highly multicultural. Our people have a high degree of responsibility.

  


Trivium Packaging is driving a large-scale business transformation across her core functions. These transformation programs require strong support from IT to implement new and improved data-driven decision-making, gain better insights in performance, standardize- and simplify processes and supporting systems, and automate & digitalize processes.

  

  

Trivium Global IT is responsible for all IT being used across Trivium. A new department within Global IT is to primarily focus on providing the required Data & Analytics, Digital, and Automation solutions to support Trivium’s transformation. A key member of the Digital & Data team is the Technical Business Analyst (Tech BA) who connects business needs to technical solutions.

  


The Technical BA understands the processes that drive Trivium Packaging. When you receive a request from the business, you are able to dig deeper in order to identify the hidden need behind that request. But you also know and understand the IT landscape and how data flows through it. This combination of business and technical expertise allows you to define the best possible data solutions for real business needs. You maximize the use and reuse of existing data tools and data flows and understand the impact of implementation choices on performance or on maintenance. The solutions that you specify help the organization to become more data-driven. Your specifications make it crystal clear to the developers what is expected of them, and make it easy to test whether deliverables meet the requirements. You identify and flag opportunities to improve our current data landscape and help shape the data platform of Trivium’s future.

  


On a day to day basis you interact with both business stakeholders and the Data & Digital development teams. You understand the different dynamics of both and easily switch between them. You closely collaborate with the Data and Digital Product Owners, who own the strategy and set the priorities for the data products they own, and with the data architect(s), who set the architectural boundaries for any solution to be developed.

  


Key Responsibilities:  

* Create clear link between the business needs emerging and the potential technical solution required by actively and proactively seeking to understand the business context
* Maximize the value delivered by the team by effectively translating business needs in solutions and workpackages for the engineers
* Guide the team to the best possible solutions within the current architecture
* Maximize re-use of existing data flows throughout the data platform
* Overseeing the effects multiple developments may have on each other, steering towards globally optimal solutions
* Provide input for improvements of the existing data model and/or solutions, based on your deep understanding of how the business and IT work
* Deliver clear specifications to the Developers group that enable them to test the deliverables according to the requirements
* Detail as much as possible the requirements which may involve sitting down with the developers to discuss at code level what may be needed
* Actively analyse where there is room for improvement in the existing data landscape and bring up the opportunities that help shape our data platform to become / remain future ready
  

Education & Training:  

* Graduate degree (e.g. Bachelor, Master, MBA, PhD etc)
  


Experience:  

* At least 5 years of relevant work experience, of which at least 2 as a (data) engineer and at least 2 as a (technical) Business Analyst.
* >2 yrs experience with data architectures that combine Integration, Data & Analytics capabilities.

* Experience in the data domain (e.g data platforms, data technology)
* Experience with agile development, including in scoping and scaling deliverables.
* Proven capability to work independently and manage multiple, competing demands
* Strong relationship development with all primary and secondary stakeholders
* Detail-oriented with excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
* Strong English verbal and written presentation skills

  


What We Offer  

* Start-up mentality with over 100 years of experience.
* A company where sustainability matters.
* Global working environment.
* Lean team with knowledgeable and supportive colleagues.
* Room to be creative, try new things, and push the envelope.
* Winning mentality
  



BRINGING YOUR TRUE SELF TO WORK


To reach our goals, we know we need colleagues at all levels who are truly diverse in every way. That’s why we are an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, age, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status or protected veteran status. Our customers come from a wide range of backgrounds, and so do our people and It’s business critical for us to ensure all our people have what they need to perform at their best and can be their true selves at work.

title: System Integration and Test Engineer - STE
description:
**Introduction to the job**

Maximizing yield, manufacturing speed, efficiency and reliability are among the key parameters for customers in high-volume chip manufacturing. Business Line Applications (BL Apps) extends ASML holistic lithography solutions by developing products that work alongside our lithography systems, in order to help them performing better and improving the patterning process.


BL Apps supports several manufacturing process steps in our customers’ fabs, from R&D to mass production. The portfolio of products includes metrology, inspection, computational lithography, data analytics and control software to quickly and accurately measure, optimize and control overlay and imaging performance on silicon wafers.
  

  

ASML’s BL Apps products are critical elements in the semiconductor manufacturing process.


**Job Mission**
---------------

The System Test Engineer (STE) in YieldStar System Integration, takes the technical lead in the integration of multiple subsystem deliveries into one complete system and testing these sets. Integration is done on both functional level and on performance level of the key performance indicators of ASML’s systems (throughput, overlay, focus etc.). STE defines the optimal integration and test strategy to achieve this goal and takes part in execution of this strategy on one or more platforms. During integration and introduction of the systems at the first customers, STE will also take the lead in the analysis of complex system issues and in the definition and testing of the solution for such issues.


**Job Description**
-------------------

* Overview of main activities



	+ define integration and test strategy: which items are needed in which order to perform stepwise integration into one system;
	+ coordinate intake of subsystem deliveries including the verification of sufficient quality;
	+ support/participate in integration tests on the system;
	+ report on system integration progress, test results and the system’s functional, performance and reliability capabilities;
	+ take lead in analysis of system issues that have been found during integration testing;
	+ define – both short and long term – solutions for system issues.
* Main Responsibilities



	+ definition of integration strategy for system integration;
	+ optimizing operational integration efficiency;
	+ reporting on integration progress and system status
	+ Tracking of STE deliverables to Project incl. disturbance handling (Prio calls)
	+ Create work breakdown for STE engineers with alignment with Project Lead
	+ More structural STE meetings to feedback information

**Education**
-------------

BSc and/or MSc level – Technical


**Experience**
--------------

At least 2 years hands-on work experience with ASML machines or integration experience on other systems


Experience in integration activities, e.g. as integrator in multidisciplinary project


**Personal skills**
-------------------

* Able to plan and prioritize
* Coaching, leadership and stakeholder management skills
* Possesses good oral presentation skills and be able to effectively present results in a team meeting
* Flexible and stress-resistant: be able to deal with changes in an uncertain and dynamic environment
* Requires the ability to read and interpret engineering specifications, maintenance manuals and engineering sketches
* Analytically strong, enthusiastic, flexible, assertive, proactive, structured;
* Ability to interface/cooperate with different people on different organizational levels;
* Ready to be employed at least 2 years;
* Ability/willingness to attend additional courses;

**Context of the position**
---------------------------

The position is in the System Integration group within the AD DE Process Window Detection Software Department in the business line Applications.
  

The System Integration group is part of D&E (Design and Engineering) and responsible for the integration of modules into a proto system and prove that the system can meet the specifications. Proto systems are used to verify the design concept at system level, which includes hardware and software. The end goal is to find all issues before the new system is pilot, i.e. in the factory and at the customer.


**Keywords**
------------

Project management, planning, system integration, proto systems, system maintenance, hardware, software, mechanics, multi-disciplinary, testing, semiconductor industry, high-tech, System integration, system testing, functional dependency diagram, root cause analysis, test and integration plans.


**Diversity and inclusion**
---------------------------

ASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.


Need to know more about applying for a job at ASML? Read our frequently asked questions .
company_description: ASML provides chipmakers with hardware, software and services to mass produce patterns on silicon, helping to build the electronic devices that keep us informed, entertained and connected.

title: Practice Lead Data Science & AI | Area Noord
description:
**Your Impact**
---------------

As a Data Science & AI Practice Lead at Ordina, you’ll put to use your proven knowledge and skills to good use in helping top-class players and developing the careers of a talented team.


You’ll create opportunities and apply your skills together with your team to real scenarios and in different domains, such as the discovery and investigation of payment flows at governmental entities, fraud detection at banks, the development of recommendation systems in the retail sector, and the optimization of supply chains.


* We are active in themes such as Natural Language Processing (NLP), Computer Vision, Machine Learning Operations (MLOps), AI Ops and Explainable A.I. (XAI). You’ll carry out creation, development and implementation of solutions with Machine Learning & Deep Learning at our clients and assess the quality and performance of existing predictive models through to bringing and keeping them into production.
  
  

**Where you're going to get started**
-------------------------------------

Ordina North is the Digital Transformation partner for customers in the North. We advise on business challenges through smart IT technology and our extensive knowledge on executing change. We use our (regional) market and customer knowledge and use this as a basis to advise and realize change in the area of business, organization, IT & Data.


At Ordina we use our successful concept of so-called High Performance Teams in which consultants work with a team of Ordina colleagues to implement solutions together with the customer. Our teams work on challenging assignments in which professional growth, cooperation and achieving results are key.


Ordina North plays an important role in realizing the (IT) ambitions of our customers. In addition to the Data Practice, Ordina North has 3 other advisory teams: Digital Product Management, Organization and Team Transformation, Strategy & Business Design. There are also three Development teams in the field of Java, Microsoft & Frontend as well as a team focused on Agile Testing. Together with your colleagues, you will bring expertise and experience on an organizational as well as a technical level to our clients.


Within Ordina North you will set up a newly built practice in our Area, you will be part of our management team in Groningen and support in developing our future direction in accordance with Ordina/Sopra Steria strategy


* Thanks to your clear vision on Data Science & AI you translate this into strategic and tactical steps for your practice and are the motor of further growth.
* Developing and integrating AI services as part of the digital transformation and future workforce within the target group and deliver more value to the customer is key.
* You also actively advise our diverse range of clients, helping to open up new opportunities and adopt the right approach.
* You delight in attracting new team members and in mentoring, training and coaching your team to take their talents forward.
  
  

**This is you**
---------------

**Your responsibilities**


* You will form and lead a team of 5-10 consultants, specialized in the various aspects of Data Science & AI: Data Strategy, Data Governance, Data Foundation, Data Analysis, Data integration of Artificial Intelligence methods and results, etc.
* You take your practice forward in diverse areas: project-based, strategic, FTE growth and employee engagement. You don't do this alone, of course. You will be assisted by your motivated team, your management colleagues, and other experts.
* You contribute to our Data Strategy to make our clients intelligent and data-driven organizations
* You spot talent and are actively involved in the selection process of new colleagues
* With support from HR, you are responsible for the successful onboarding of your new Ordina team members
* You have a clear vision & ideas about Data & AI and its place within digital & business transformation processes. Together with the management team, you successfully expand and realize these ideas & vision.
* You focus on solutions and success

**This is you**


* Master's degree or the equivalent in experience in a Data Science field as a Data Scientist, Machine Learning Engineer, MLOps, or Software Engineer
* You can communicate fluently in Dutch ;
* You are passionate about people and, thanks to your human skills, you can create the right climate in which to develop your colleagues and teams to their full potential.
* Communication comes easily and, combined with your commercial mind, dealing with customers and develop new opportunities comes naturally.
* As an excellent multitasker, you always keep a keen eye on your internal and external partners.
* Demonstrated experience in people management and a entrepreneurial mindset
* Experience in some of the following Data Science techniques:
	+ supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms
	+ deep learning
	+ anomaly detection
	+ recommender systems
	+ natural language processing
	+ computer vision and reinforcement learning
	+ autoencoders, transformers, forecasting
* Experience in one of the following languages:
	+ Python
	+ R
* Experience in bringing Data Science solutions/software to production (Azure, AWS, GCP, Kubernetes, Docker, etc.)
* Experience in building and implementing advanced analytics solutions and you can provide some reference cases
* In-depth knowledge of open-source software and libraries in Python and/or R for machine and deep learning
* Experience in big data and platforms such as Azure Machine Learning Services and Amazon SageMaker is an advantage

Just good is not good enough; you want to be among the best in your field. That’s why you’re trying hard to achieve your full potential, by constantly looking for ways to broaden your knowledge and keeping track of the latest developments. You’re also looking for ways to further improve yourself or to grow as part of a team.

  

  

**Benefits**
------------

Ordina wants to offer employees an environment in which they can be themselves and develop optimally. In doing so, our guiding principles are:


* Our people are our highest priority;
* We are building a learning organization with an open culture;
* We do meaningful work with impact for our clients.
  

  

As an Ordina employee, you can count on:


* Flexible working hours;
* A salary appropriateto the role;
* Mobility allowance (choice between a lease car or a transport allowance);
* A bonus scheme based on performance;
* Study and training opportunities; free to grow and develop as you wish;
* A pension plan, to which you are not obliged to contribute.
  
  

  

Everyone is welcome to apply. Because we believe in the power of diversity and value inclusion. After all, the best ideas and smartest solutions arise in diverse teams. That is exactly why we pay so much attention to the composition of our high performance teams. So that you feel at home and can get the best out of yourself.

title: HVAC Engineer
description:
Coolgradient is a fast-growing green-tech start-up with a clear vision to make our digital footprint more sustainable.

**Why?**

Every swipe, every like, every TikTok video we upload, every Zoom call we have, every Netflix video we watch, or everything we buy online is all processed and depends on… data centers. However, these data centers consume large amounts of energy due to the underlying technology we use every day all day.

**How?** 

We have developed an AI-based analytics platform that captures the entire data center (DC) infrastructure - "from roof to room" - to bring the whole DC into a more optimal state. Saving energy and increasing reliability that results in a more sustainable data center in countries like Germany, France, Switzerland, UK, Ireland and The Netherlands.

We are looking for a highly skilled HVAC Design Specialist M/F/X with a strong background in HVAC systems and/or energy technology to join our team.

**What you’ll do**

In this role you’ll work with data related to cooling, power and energy storage systems of data centers. You will use your understanding of HVAC systems to analyze the sensor data and identify areas for improvement. You will be responsible for providing valuable insights to our team and our clients, identifying trends and patterns in data sets, and communicate these to local operations teams.

**Additionally you will**

* Improve HVAC (CFD/2D/1D physics simulation) models and understand cooling layout and design options.
* Continuously monitor and evaluate data to ensure accuracy and identify areas for improvement.
* Stay up-to-date with industry trends and advancements.

Job requirements

* Degree in systems engineering, energy technology or a related field.
* Proficiency in data analysis tools and software, such as Python and SQL.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to work with large data sets and identify trends and patterns.
* Pre when experience with data center design
* Pre when experience with Energy Plus, Modelica or similar.

**Perks**

* Working on making the world of data centers more sustainable
* Enjoy a competitive salary, pension scheme, holiday allowance, and disability insurance.
* Our goal is to increase our impact and grow. We want you to grow with us and offer an Employee Stock Option Plan.
* A hybrid home-office-remote policy with flexible working hours where we value your regular presence to enjoy team dynamics, but we like to support the flexibility that fits your daily rhythm and preference.
* Lots of mobility options, where we provide a lease car, public transportation subscription, or company bike, or we’ll reimburse your travels when you prefer to use your own means of mobility.
* Lots of opportunities for professional growth and development.
* Join activities like meetups or (business) events.
* Work abroad with the team, where we combine good weather, a great environment, and good food.
* And above all: a fun and enthusiastic team that values a diverse and transparent culture.

**Visa**

At our company, we highly appreciate and encourage diversity. We believe it is crucial to achieving success and being the responsible company we want to be. However, currently, *our company cannot* *sponsor any work visas.*

Apply to this link: https://coolgradient.recruitee.com/o/hvac-design-specialist

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: €5.000,00 - €8.000,00 per month

title: Oracle Security Expert
description:
**Security*** **Rotterdam**
* **Medior**
* **HBO**
**Highlights**
--------------


Een bruto maandsalaris van minimaal € 4368,- en maximaal € 6569,- afhankelijk van je werkervaring
* 50% korting op KPN-producten en -diensten
* Een 37-urige werkweek
  

#19963
**Ben jij klaar om jouw expertise in Oracle Cloud Applications naar een hoger niveau te tillen? Bij Finance Insights & Analytics krijg je de kans om een belangrijke rol te spelen in het beheer en de verbetering van ons Oracle Security Framework. Werk samen met top professionals, ontwikkel je vaardigheden verder, en draag bij aan de toekomst van ons Oracle Reporting team. Kies voor een dynamische werkomgeving met veel mogelijkheden voor persoonlijke groei en kennisuitwisseling.**

  

**Jouw rol als Oracle Security Expert**
---------------------------------------


In deze rol als Oracle Security Expert ben jij de spil in het waarborgen van het Security Framework voor onze Oracle Cloud Applicatie. Hieronder vallen HCM/ERP/SCM, de Enterprise Performance Applications (EPM) en Fusion Data Intelligence (FDI). Je krijgt de kans om je vaardigheden te benutten en verder te ontwikkelen, terwijl je samenwerkt met diverse teams. Je takenpakket is gevarieerd en uitdagend, waarbij je een directe impact hebt op onze bedrijfscontinuïteit en security-standaarden. Je taken omvatten onder andere:

* Opzetten en beheren van het Security Framework vanuit het functionele domein, inclusief het configureren van functionele rollen en rechten en het gedegen documenteren hiervan.
* Fungeren als sparringpartner met IT en andere ketenpartners om het Security Framework te optimaliseren.
* Beheren van het incidentenmanagementproces in samenwerking met IT: incidenten analyseren, opvolging verzorgen, en coördineren van oplossingen met andere oplosgroepen.
* Uitvoeren van periodieke assessments voor security- en risicomanagement in samenwerking met IT, en het adviseren van product owners en andere stakeholders binnen het Security Framework
* Implementeren van continuous improvement-activiteiten, waaronder de vereenvoudiging van het Security Framework.


**Dit is je team**
------------------


Binnen de afdeling Finance Insights & Analytics (FIA) werk je samen met ongeveer 40 professionals, waaronder developers, data scientists, data engineers, consultants, scrum masters en product owners. Als onderdeel van het Oracle Reporting Centre of Excellence (CoE) werk je in een Scrum-team bestaande uit een product owner, een scrummaster, vijf developers en twee consultants. Je werkt intensief samen met collega's uit IT, HR, GBS, Risk Management en Finance.  

**Wat breng**
**jij ons?**
--------------------------


Voor de rol van Oracle Security Expert bij KPN is het belangrijk dat je werk proactief oppakt en zelfstandig taken initieert. Je werkt goed in teamverband en beschikt over uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden. Samen met je collega's ontwikkel je nieuwe inzichten op een Agile manier. Jouw expertise draagt bij aan de innovatie en transformatie van deze functie. Je hebt kennis van de volgende tools en vaardigheden:.

* Je hebt een HBO of WO-diploma
* 6 jaar relevante werkervaring, inclusief ervaring met DevOps, Scrum en Agile
* Kennis van Oracle SaaS rollen en data access inclusief die van het Fusion Data Intelligence Platform
* Kennis van risk management & functiescheiding, Identity & Access Management (IAM) applicatie
* Bekendheid met Advanced Access Control (AAC) binnen Oracle is een pluspunt
* Kennis van processen binnen het Finance en HR-domein, evenals ondersteunende Oracle Cloud Application-modules, wordt gewaardeerd.


Tik je niet alle bullets aan? We nodigen je alsnog van harte uit om te reageren.  

**Wat krijg je**
**van ons?**
-----------------------------


Natuurlijk hebben we als werkgever jou ook veel te bieden. Dit krijg je van ons:

* Een bruto maandsalaris van minimaal €4300- en maximaal €6569,- afhankelijk van je werkervaring op basis van 37 uur
* Keuzetijd tot en met 40 uur per week mogelijk, waardoor je er maximaal 8,5% brutosalaris bij krijgt
* Een toeslag van 10,5% van je bruto maandsalaris (inclusief 8% vakantiegeld)
* Een variabele-bonusregeling van 9% behorende bij schaal 11
* Jaarlijks een individuele en collectieve verhoging conform onze CAO
* Goede doorgroei- en opleidingsmogelijkheden en een persoonlijk opleidingsbudget van € 1500,-. Sterker nog, we verwachten van jou dat jij je blijft ontwikkelen!
* Een goede werk-privé balans (zoals 2 dagen kantoor, 3 dagen thuis, transitieverlof, feestdagwissel naar een feestdag van jouw religieuze of culturele voorkeur)
* Thuiswerkshop om je werkplek thuis optimaal in te kunnen richten, uiteraard met een mobiele telefoon & laptop
* 50% korting op KPN-producten en -diensten, zoals KPN-internet
* Een reiskostenvergoeding voor woon-werkverkeer: zoals onze fietsvergoeding van € 0,40 per kilometer, of € 0,23 per kilometer, of volledige vergoeding 2e klas OV. Daarnaast krijg je € 10,- per maand internetvergoeding en een thuiswerkvergoeding van € 2,15 per dag
* Uitstekende pensioenvoorwaarden: een totale inleg van 23% van je pensioengevende salaris waarvan KPN 16% inlegt en jij 7%

  

Ons geloof in technologie is groot. Dit wordt nóg krachtiger samen met menselijk contact, daarom ontmoeten we je graag!


Wil je meer weten? Neem contact op met onze recruiter Sabina via sabina.bharati@kpn.com

  


**Wat gebeurt er**
**na je sollicitatie?**
------------------------------------------


**01**
**Telefonisch contact**
-----------------------


Onze recruiters leren je graag beter kennen en nemen daarom telefonisch contact met je op!
**02**
**Gesprekken**
--------------


Zijn we van beide kanten enthousiast? Dan plannen we een eerste, tweede en eventueel een derde gesprek en/of assesment in.
**03**
**Wij doen jou een aanbod**
---------------------------


Als alle gesprekken goed zijn gegaan, doen we je een aanbod. Een screening kan onderdeel zijn van dit proces.
**04**
**Welkom in het team**
----------------------


Als je blij bent met het aanbod en je het contract hebt getekend, begint jouw onboarding. Welkom bij KPN!

title: Principal Value Engineer - Strategic Accounts
description:
We're Celonis, the global leader in Process Mining technology and one of the world's fastest-growing SaaS firms. We believe there is a massive opportunity to unlock productivity by placing data and intelligence at the core of business processes - and for that, we need you to join us.


**The Role:**



As a **Principal Value Engineer**, you are spearheading our mission of data-driven business transformation with a selection of few of our strategic customers. You will have full responsibility for the end-to-end value journey of these customers, working in partnership with the Celonis Sales Teams and orchestrating all Value Engineering activities for an account. You are our customers trusted advisor and help them achieve their strategic goals and realize significant value using Celonis Process Intelligence Platform. In collaboration with our partners and Celonis Services, you will drive measurable business impact across various processes and industries and accelerate the adoption of our platform. You will blend deep process and industry expertise with a proven consulting skill set with strong analytical skills at the forefront of one of the fastest-growing tech companies worldwide.

  

**The work you’ll do:**


**Identify & Frame Value**


* Discover and translate customers’ strategic priorities into high-impact Celonis use cases
* Build demos and business cases, leveraging industry benchmarks and best practices in order to win new customers
* Undertake Value Assessments or Proof-of-Value Projects and communicate the value opportunity and strategic roadmap to C-Level executives


**Realize Value**


* Facilitate business value workshops and use Celonis to identify and qualify opportunities for process enhancement
* Derive improvement measures in core business functions and initiate improvement actions and enterprise-wide change initiatives
* Present results and realized value to senior management and C-level executives


**Scale Value**


* Responsible for the end-to-end customer value journey, landing, expanding, adoption and renewing
* Build a strategic expansion roadmap for customers embedding Celonis Process Intelligence Platform as a strategic business transformation platform in their organization and therefore drive adoption and expansion
* Provide feedback to our product development teams to enhance the Celonis platform and Apps based on new use cases

  


**The qualifications you need:**


* **Strategic perspective and depth of expertise:** **10+ years** of relevant experience
* **Live for Customer Value:** Experience in an analytical and strategic role with the objective to demonstrate or secure value through business data analysis, business process improvement and/or respective Software deployment. Ideally in a customer-facing role with a Consultancy or a Business Software / SaaS Provider. Alternatively in an Inhouse role (e.g. Center of Excellence for Data Mining / Analytics / Intelligence) within an Enterprise.
* **Value Selling & Executive Stakeholder Management:** Excellent communication and presentation skills in German (fluent) and English. Experienced in preparing and communicating roadmaps and results to stakeholders. Sales acumen, sovereign and winning appearance.
* **Data, Analytics, Applications & IT:** Good knowledge of Business Software / SaaS applications (e.g. SAP), experience with implementing RPA or BI Tools or building Dashboards or Apps /Action Flows. Knowledge of Python and/or SQL. Experience in collaborating with IT teams.
* **Process Improvement & Value Realization:** Experience in identifying use cases for business process improvement and deploying improvement measures, being a change agent and training users/process owners to realize value.
* **Project Management:** Experience in planning and managing project scopes, expectations and timelines.
* **Business Domain Expertise:** Excellent understanding of the Finance and Supply Chain function and / or strategic transformation initiatives (e.g. Shared Services Transformation or System Transformation)
* **Industry Expertise**: Excellent understanding of industry trends, common challenges / success factors and strategic opportunities in the Food Retail industry
* **Degree:** in Industrial/Business Engineering, Technology and/or Management, Informatics, Mathematics or similar


**What Celonis can offer you:**


* The unique opportunity to work with industry-leading process mining technology
* Investment in your personal growth and skill development (clear career paths, internal mobility opportunities, L&D platform, mentorships, and more)
* Great compensation and benefits packages (equity (restricted stock units), life insurance, time off, generous leave for new parents from day one, and more)
* Physical and mental well-being support (subsidized gym membership, access to counseling, virtual events on well-being topics, and more)
* A global and growing team of Celonauts from diverse backgrounds to learn from and work with
* An open-minded culture with innovative, autonomous teams
* Business Resource Groups to help you feel connected, valued and seen (Black@Celonis, Women@Celonis, Parents@Celonis, Pride@Celonis, Resilience@Celonis, and more)
* A clear set of company values that guide everything we do: Live for Customer Value, The Best Team Wins, We Own It, and Earth Is Our Future


**About Us**



Since 2011, Celonis has helped thousands of the world's largest and most valued companies deliver immediate cash impact, radically improve customer experience and reduce carbon emissions. Its Process Intelligence platform uses industry-leading process mining technology and AI to present companies with a living digital twin of their end-to-end processes. For the first time, everyone in an organisation has a common language about how the business works, visibility into where value is hidden and the ability to capture it. Celonis is headquartered in Munich (Germany) and New York (USA) and has more than 20 offices worldwide.



Join us as we make processes work for people, companies and the planet.

  

Celonis is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: Technical Architect
description:
**About the Role:**


As a key member of our team, you will collaborate with clients, engineers, and business developers to design cutting-edge software, data, and cloud solutions. As we expand our client base in the Netherlands, you will also assist our business developers with pre-sales activities.


**Your daily task will include**


️ lead technical refinements and architectural sessions to ensure projects stay on track and meet requirements


️ collaborate with customers, users, and Scrum team members to identify, analyze, understand, and specify project requirements


️ propose alternative solutions to overcome professional or technical obstacles that arise during projects


️ attend client meetings and provide technical architectural solutions


️ assist the senior business development team with pre-sales activities to secure new clients


️ visualize processes and requirements to enhance communication and understanding among team members and stakeholders


️ be the go-to person for technical questions and provide technical support to your team


️ ensure projects adhere to our technical quality standards, such as test-driven development


️ design sustainable, state-of-the-art software solutions


️ provide technical leadership and guide your team in their professional growth  

  

**The following will make you succeed in this role**


️ fluency in Dutch and English (Dutch is a must for client interactions)


️ proficiency in designing and communicating software architecture in cloud systems to all stakeholders


️ ability to estimate the financial impact of architecture alternatives


️ in-depth knowledge of analytics, object-oriented programming (OOP), design patterns, and modularization


️ hands-on experience with container technologies (Kubernetes) and ideally with Hyperscalers (Azure, AWS, Google)


️ residency in or around Amsterdam to collaborate effectively with your team


️ insight into current and future technology trends, especially in sales contexts


️ ability to understand complex topics and processes, and translate them into actionable insights


️ detail-oriented with a strong grasp of the big picture


️ experience in starting software development projects from scratch and set standards for successful project delivery

*We are an equal opportunity employer. We strive to create an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive regardless of their background and circumstances. All applicants receive equal opportunity regardless of age, gender identity or expression, language, disability, ethnicity, national origin, religion, or sexual orientation.*

  

We will go through your application and come back with feedback.


Any questions? Contact us at jobs@cloudflight.io

title: Logistics Engineer I/II/III
description:
**Career Opportunity**

  


Sappi Somerset is among the largest paper mills in North America, producing over 970,000 metric tons of graphics and board paper and 530,000 metric tons of pulp each year. The mill began as a greenfield pulp mill in 1976, supplying fiber for Scott paper tissue mills. The first of three state-of-the-art coated paper machines was installed in 1982, with subsequent machines installed in 1986 and 1990. Significant reinvestments over the years has maintained Somerset's edge on technology and also to branch out from traditional graphic paper into SBS board grades with the rebuild of PM1 in 2018. The mill can also produce market pulp based on fiber balance, and continues to push for world class status in the realms of safety, quality, and productivity.

  


Position (job title): **[[title]]**


Department: [[filter1]]


Work Site: [[filter7]]

  


**Summary:**

This position is responsible for the day to day analysis and optimization of logistics operations which includes ensuring that the processes, technology, and/or infrastructure to support the efficient and cost-effective execution of distribution are in place. This position develops business cases that evaluate transportation routes, modes, and rates, warehouse and transportation operations, and distribution requirements planning. They also will focus on building relationships with customers and logistics service providers. In addition, the Logistics Engineer troubleshoots operational issues to ensure timely and cost effective delivery to our customers.

  


This individual works across organization boundaries, with sales personnel and with the customer themselves to better understand the needs of the business and to establish innovative programs to better serve the interests of the customer and Sappi. They also work with procurement services to evaluate and purchase logistic services and work with legal and financial staff to ensure compliance. In addition, the Logistics Engineer is responsible for the accuracy and quality of the flow of material through the various distribution channels and physical inventory and that standard practices are employed.

  


**Responsibilities:**

  

* Utilizes project management and problem solving skills to assess the effectiveness of current logistics and/or transportation processes, determines improvements, evaluates cost and coordinates institutionalized change.
* Develops and maintains standard operating procedures and performance standards.
* Inventory management and product forecasting.
* Inbound and outbound logistics and warehousing coordination.
* Coordinates the daily inbound rail requirements and onsite rail yard management.
* Analyzes Logistics network, optimizing delivery times and cost of delivery.
* Analyze vendor proposals, pricing structures and performance criteria to make recommendations and assists with the buying of logistics service.
  


**Minimum Education and Skills Requirements:**


* Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain Management, Engineering, Logistics, Business Studies or equivalent job related experience.
* Minimum 2 to 7 years’ experience preferred with proven leadership skills
* Knowledge of computer based design and analysis tools – simulation, work measurement, spreadsheet, and database analysis
* Strong background in engineering, math, analytics and visualization or optimization techniques
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills required
* Ability to manage multiple tasks, self-sufficient and self-directed
* Capable of building strong relationships across organization boundaries
* Familiar with logistics contracts and tariffs, warehousing and inventory management
* Travel, as needed for job

  


Salary is determined by a number of factors including the value of the job to the organization, market forces, internal equity and skills brought to the job.


HR Contact for Questions: [[recruiterName]]


Contact Information: [[custrecruiterPhone]] , [[custrecruiterEmail]]

  


*Sappi provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Sappi complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.*

title: Data vault Engineer
description:
+ 3-5 years

+ 36 - 40 uur
+ Data

+ €55.000 - €78.000


* Advanced development of data warehousing solutions on Snowflake's cutting-edge platform.
* Direct contribution to smarter, cleaner energy solutions for a sustainable future.
* Hands-on engagement with the latest cloud data technologies and agile methodologies.

Why choose for Eneco?
Why choose Eneco? We want to accelerate the energy transition. With our ambitious ‘One Planet plan’, we have made it clear that by 2035, we aim to be the first energy company to become CO2-neutral. No more reliance on natural gas! The entire Netherlands is making the switch. Towards smarter, cleaner, and more sustainable energy. Everyone has their own reasons for doing so. Some want to contribute to a better climate, others switch because their neighbors are doing it, or because they find joy in saving energy, and we're doing it now!


At Eneco, we want to help everyone to take the next sustainable step. And we are looking for the best people who can make that possible. People who are enthusiastic about our mission of 'sustainable energy for everyone' and who want to further develop their talents at Eneco. We want everyone to be able to participate effortlessly in the energy transition. This can only happen if we better assist our customers, remove barriers for them to become more sustainable by listening and understanding their true needs.


Digital innovations help the market align supply and demand and make it as easy as possible for users. Data plays a crucial role in this. From the Data & Technology Services department, we are working to make Eneco a data-driven organization that bases its decisions and actions on customer, product, asset, and market data.


What you’ll do* You will architect and fine-tune data models on our cutting-edge Snowflake platform, ensuring efficient data processing with your expertise in Snowflake’s SQL dialect and optimization techniques.
* With a proficient grasp of Azure DevOps, you will manage CI/CD pipelines, code repositories, and automated testing strategies.
* Your scripting skills, particularly in Python, will be key in automating repetitive tasks for efficiency gains.
* Additionally, your understanding of the Scrum framework and Apache Airflow will contribute to an agile and well-orchestrated data operation.
* You will be modelling and building the datavault from the functional designs.
* It's likely that weekend shifts will be part of this position in the near future, where we rotate these shifts wthin the team.

Is this about you?* Adept in the architecture, data loading, storage options, and security features of the Snowflake cloud data platform - experience with maintaining Data Vaults and Data Marts
* Competent in Azure DevOps for CI/CD, with a solid understanding of code management and automated testing deployment strategies.
* Proficient in Python for scripting and automation.
* Familiar with the Scrum framework and Apache Airflow's architecture and concepts.
* You are prepared to take on weekend shifts in the future.

You’ll be responsible for* Designing and maintaining Data Vaults and Data Marts within Snowflake, ensuring high performance and security.
* Implementing data solutions that foster business growth, utilizing Azure DevOps, CI/CD, and Datavault in a secure, compliant manner.
* Embracing the Scrum framework to facilitate agile project management and employing Apache Airflow for efficient workflow orchestration.
* You build it, you run it. Ensuring that everything keeps on running, sometimes working outside business hours.

This is where you’ll work
Data & Technology Services has multiple departments; Data Services has 3 teams – an enterprise datamanagement team, a data analytics team and a data engineer team.


What we have to offer
Gross annual salary between €55.000 and €78.000


Including 8% holiday allowance, a good pension and parental leave.
FlexBudget on top of your gross salary


Have it paid out, use it to buy extra holiday days or save it up for something nice - it's up to you.
Personal and professional growth


Eneco is fully committed to help you in your personal and professional development.
Hybrid working, at home or in the office


You work 40% at the office and 40% at home. The other day you decide what works best for you.
Work that works for you and the climate
If you decide on a career at Eneco, you are choosing ambition, growth and opportunities. You will have all the space you want to improve yourself and do your job the way that suits you best, which includes having a good work-life balance. You can work to a flexible schedule and work partly from home if your role allows it.
That is how you can work on your own future and on the future of the world. After all, you and your 4,000 colleagues are committed to our mission: climate neutrality by 2035. We assist customers to accelerate their sustainability efforts, devise innovative solutions and seize opportunities with both hands. Are you ready?
The stages of our application procedure:


Stap 1


Your application
Stap 2


We carefully review your application
Stap 3


We invite you for a 1st (online) interview
Stap 4


Sometimes we want to get to know you even better, then there will be an online assessment and a 2nd interview
Stap 5


Yes! If it’s a match and if you agree, the recruiter will happily discuss your job offer
Want to know more about this job function?
We understand that you may want to learn more before taking the next step in your career. Therefore, we encourage you to reach out to our recruiter, Mark van Dommelen. Whether you have questions about the interview process, the specific duties and responsibilities of the role, or are simply curious about the company culture, we are here to answer all your inquiries.  

  

**For the recruitment of this position, we prefer to handle the process internally and do not wish to collaborate with external parties.**

title: Business analist
description:
Zet de volgende stap in jouw carrière als business/data-analist bij de Belastingdienst! Vanuit Utrecht speel jij een cruciale rol bij het verzamelen, analyseren en interpreteren van gegevens. Je levert een waardevolle bijdrage in het verbeteren van de kwaliteit van verschillende informatieproducten. In het bijzonder bij het neerzetten van gestandaardiseerde data voor al onze BI-producten. Je collega’s zijn je dankbaar, want dankzij jou kunnen zij onze interne klanten van uniforme informatie voorzien waarmee de Belastingdienst op strategisch en tactisch niveau wordt bestuurd!

 **Dit doe je bij de Belastingdienst**  

Je werkt als business/data-analist samen met een groep betrokken collega-data-engineers en -analisten binnen de afdeling Managementinformatie van Datafundamenten & Analytics (DF&A). Hier streven we naar een uniform datalandschap voor de gehele BI van DF&A. Het doel van de afdeling is om een robuuste, eenduidige dataomgeving te realiseren waarop bouwteams hun producten kunnen aansluiten. In onze MI-strategie heeft het ontwikkelen van een robuuste dataomgeving een prominente plek.


Binnen het team is het werk nooit eenduidig en kunnen prioriteiten nog wel eens schuiven. Het team is recent opgericht en daardoor kan je nog meedenken over de aanpak en hoe het team het beste waarde kan toevoegen. We zijn enthousiast en gedreven om producten van hoge kwaliteit te leveren en gaan voor generieke oplossingen, niet voor puntoplossingen.


In jouw rol als Business/Data Analist ben je verantwoordelijk voor het helder krijgen en formuleren van de functionele en technische behoefte van de bouwteams en onze klanten. In het klantcontact vraag je door naar de vraag achter de vraag en ben je gewend om aan verschillende onderwerpen tegelijk te werken.
  

Je ben de spin in het web en degene die de klantvraag vertaalt naar duidelijke opdrachtbeschrijvingen en stories. Daarnaast lijkt het je leuk om in code en data te duiken en al puzzelend tot oplossingen te komen. Binnen DF&A en de afdeling MI is al veel kennis en ervaring aanwezig over businessprocessen en MI. In jouw rol ga je hier actief naar op zoek en ben je gemakkelijk in het contact leggen met kennisdragers.

 **Een bijzondere baan, omdat...*** Je aan de slag gaat met de grootste verzameling data van Nederland.
* Je in een organisatie komt waarin nog niet alles is vastgelegd en waarin je in belangrijke mate kan bijdragen aan de uiteindelijke proces- én productinrichting ervan.
* Jij je verder kunt ontwikkelen bij onze eigen DF&A-academy. Ook heb je fijne collega’s van wie je kunt leren.
* We driedagenchallenges (hackaton) organiseren en je de mogelijkheid krijgt om mee te werken aan innovaties.
  

'*Geen dag is hetzelfde, op het ene moment ben ik aan het puzzelen op processen in de data, op een ander moment denk ik mee met andere teams of de business over*  

*hoe we producten aan kunnen sluiten op uniforme definities. Zo leer ik elke dag wat nieuws*.'

 **Wanneer past deze baan bij je?**  

Functie-eisen  

* Je hebt een wo-werk- en -denkniveau.
* Je hebt minimaal 4 jaar werkervaring met data-analyses of analytische toepassingen.
* Je bent van nature communicatief en legt gemakkelijk contact.
* Je kunt programmeren, bij voorkeur in (Teradata) SQL of SAS.
* Je spreekt en schrijft uitstekend Nederlands.

  

Herken jij jezelf ook hierin?


Je hebt een flinke dosis doorzettingsvermogen, bent stressbestendig en je beschikt over goede communicatieve eigenschappen. Je vindt het leuk om afwisseling te hebben in je werk en jij kunt zowel energie halen uit het zoeken naar de juiste data als het schakelen met de business. Je vindt het leuk om jouw teamgenoten te ondersteunen in het vertalen van de businesswensen naar een generieke dataoplossing. Tevens verdiep je je graag in de data die binnen de belastingdienst aanwezig is.


De functie is ingeschaald in schaal 11 voor minimaal 32 en maximaal 36 uur.

 **Jouw competenties**  


Resultaatgerichtheid
Analyseren
Flexibiliteit
Samenwerken
Organisatiesensitiviteit  

**De afdeling -** ***Corporate Dienst Datafundamenten en Analytics***  

De Corporate Dienst Datafundamenten en Analytics (DF&A) werkt voor directies van de Belastingdienst die belast zijn met de fiscale behandeling van burgers en bedrijven én voor bedrijfsvoering. DF&A levert signaalmodellen en informatiedashboards die zijn gebaseerd op de analyse van ‘big data’ en die de organisatie inzicht geven in de mogelijkheden om werkzaamheden slimmer en beter uit te voeren. Zo kunnen op informatie-gestuurde wijze keuzes worden gemaakt in bijvoorbeeld handhavingsstrategieën, behandeladviezen en procesinrichtingen.  

De signaalmodellen en dashboards worden gebouwd door gebruik te maken van innovatieve IT-ontwikkelingen en het koppelen van zeer divers aangeleverde data. DF&A maakt hiervoor gebruik van een zelfontwikkelde methodiek om data op te bouwen tot datafundamenten, die de basis zijn voor de producten.

 **De organisatie**  

Belastingdienst  

Bij de Belastingdienst werken ongeveer 25.000 mensen verspreid over het hele land aan een financieel gezond Nederland. Dit doen we door eerlijk en zorgvuldig belastingen en premies volksverzekeringen te heffen, te innen en te controleren en fraude op te sporen. De Belastingdienst maakt het burgers en bedrijven zo gemakkelijk mogelijk om verplichtingen na te kunnen komen en gebruik te kunnen maken van rechten. Dat gebeurt met passende dienstverlening, door massale processen juist en tijdig uit te voeren én door adequaat toezicht uit te oefenen. De Belastingdienst is sterk in ontwikkeling en heeft de ambitie om de beste Belastingdienst voor Nederland te zijn met focus op fiscale taken en vakmanschap. Lees meer over de Belastingdienst op: https://over-ons.belastingdienst.nl

 **Bijzonderheden**  

We ontvangen je brief en cv graag in een Word- of PDF-bestand. Neem in de bestandsnaam jouw voor- en achternaam op. Als je een beroep doet op een voorrangspositie, stuur dan ook een kopie van die kennisgeving mee.


Onze selectieprocedure voor deze functie ziet er als volgt uit:

* Allereerst wordt beoordeeld of een voorrangskandidaat binnen de Rijksoverheid in aanmerking komt voor deze functie.
* Daarna wordt beoordeeld of jouw cv en motivatiebrief voldoen aan de gestelde functie-eisen. We streven ernaar jouw sollicitatie op korte termijn te beoordelen en indien geschikt, uit te nodigen voor een gesprek. De mogelijkheid bestaat dat bij het vinden van een geschikte kandidaat de vacature eerder gesloten wordt.

Onderaan deze vacature vind je meer uitleg over de stappen die je doorloopt in de sollicitatieprocedure.


De voorkeur gaat uit naar kandidaten die het meest aansluiten bij het opgestelde profiel. Dit heeft betrekking op zowel de genoemde kennis en werkervaring als op het opleidingsniveau. Vermeld deze daarom duidelijk in je cv.


De Belastingdienst zet zich in voor de banenafspraak: zoveel mogelijk banen realiseren voor mensen met een arbeidsbeperking. Val jij in deze doelgroep? Wij zullen je ondersteunen zodat je optimaal kunt functioneren, en daarmee jouw bijdrage aan Nederland kunt leveren. Of het nu gaat om aanpassingen op je werkplek, bepaalde voorzieningen in het vervoer of bijvoorbeeld vergoedingen van het UWV: samen met jou, je leidinggevende én een jobcoach gaan wij kijken naar jouw kwaliteiten en mogelijkheden om een passend werkpakket uit te voeren. Wil jij weten of je hierbij hoort en wat dit exact betekent voor jou? Lees hier meer.


Een (online) voorselectietest en/of een assessment kan deel uit maken van de sollicitatieprocedure, evenals het maken van een casus, het opvragen van referenties en (online) screening, bijvoorbeeld via databanken, (zoekmachines) en sociale netwerken.


Jouw sollicitatie wordt alleen in behandeling genomen als je met de sollicitatie-button reageert en je cv en motivatiebrief zijn bijgesloten. Na sluitingsdatum is het niet meer mogelijk om je sollicitatie in behandeling te nemen. Houd er rekening mee dat het solliciteren technische problemen met zich mee kan brengen. Wacht hiermee dus niet tot het laatste moment.


Wanneer je solliciteert op een functie maak je eenmalig een account aan. Met je account kan je de status van je sollicitatie inzien.
company_description: De Belastingdienst is 24 uur per dag, 7 dagen per week in bedrijf. We werken aan een financieel gezond Nederland door eerlijk en zorgvuldig belastingen te heffen, te innen en toezicht uit te oefenen.

title: Senior BI Developer
description:
Position Summary
The BI Developer is responsible in developing the BI solutions such as a self-service dashboard by engineering data pipelines and workflows, translating business requirements into technical solutions with hands-on skills in visualizations. You communicate with various stakeholders such as the Business units, marketing department, BI functions, support functions and other teams in Data and Analytics.
Role and Responsibilities
Stakeholder management* Collaborate with Business Owners, Data engineers, Business Analysts and Data Scientists to align business requirements with data
* Map requirements and projects from stakeholders, including Business Divisions, Marketing Channel experts, and Marketing Strategy teams.
* Establish collaboration with European and global teams working on BI and Analytics projects
* Evangelize the data-driven decision-making to the stakeholders while communicating in a plain and intuitive language so that stakeholders easily follow even the sophisticated and technical concepts.
* Train and guide stakeholders how to use BI tools and solutions


Data Visualization and reports creation* Create and maintain the automatic reporting work processes (Sales, marketing, Ops, etc)
* Manage the automated/self-serving data visualization projects by building the foundation layer for dashboard reporting.
* Convert data into a suitable graphic format including - dashboards, graphs, charts, and reports using BI tools (Power BI)
* Develop and manage BI extension tool for user interaction, such as PowerApps
* Automate reporting in the BI tool via paginated reports in PowerBI or PowerAutomate
* Robotic Process Automation in generating the standards marketing performance reports
* Handling ad-hoc report or data requests


Data Engineering* Collect and connect data from different sources according to a business's needs, use cases, potential exploitation and deployment, and technology possibilities: GCP, Azure, and local servers.
* Model raw data into clean, tested, and reusable datasets, make it easier for business analysts and other stakeholders to view and understand data in DB, with a data engineer or standalone
* Apply various and automated transformations (ETL, ELT) to different data pieces to ensure they correspond to given tasks  

removing inaccurate or corrupted data
* Perform (and Guide juniors) maintenance and troubleshooting activities for data engineering and BI tools.


Data infrastructure and governance support* Support Data warehouse governance and access management
* Recommend strategies to improve performance and capacity of BI tools.
* Support and advise in developing security and authentication standards for the department and users.
* Maintain accurate and complete technical architecture documents.
* Support in defining BI standards, guidelines and best practices for business groups and technical teams.


Your team
You will be part of the Central Data Analytics team in Schiphol, Netherlands. We are providing marketing and business analytics solutions as well as the consumer, market, and business insights. You will be part of the BI team, one of the critical pillars of Data & Analytics success at Samsung. Your team consists of data engineers, BI & visualization developers, and closely works with the Advanced Analytics team.
Skills and Qualifications
Your skills and qualifications
 (Requirements)
As a BI Developer you have the following qualification(s):* Bachelor or Master degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Econometrics, Business Information Management, or an equivalent study
* 5+ years of experience working in BI, Dashboard development, or Analytics
* Proven Technical Experience in ETL and relational data base management, and data modeling using the following tools: Python, SQL, Big Query
* Hands-on skills in data visualization tools (Power BI/ Tableau/Looker), preferably PowerBI.
* Knowledge and hands-on skills in data engineering, API, and cloud computing (GCP, Azure, and Databricks)
* English proficiency
* Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects, and forge strong interpersonal relationships within the department, with other departments, and with external audiences.
* Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills to effectively communicate information to all levels within the organization
* Excellent networking, project management, and organizational skills
* Excellent OA software skills such as Excel, Word, and Powerpoint


Preferred qualifications
The ideal BI Developer recognize themselves in the following profile:
(Advantages)* Skills in PowerApps and PowerAutomate are a huge plus
* Skills in Robotic Process Automation (RPA) and Web scraping are a huge plus.
* Knowledge in Statistics, Econometrics and Machine Learning is a huge plus
* Knowledge and hands-on skills in Machine learning engineering are a huge plus
* Experience with SQL performance tuning and E2E process optimization
* Experience with Airflow
* Experience with designing and implementing real-time data pipelines
* Strong knowledge in one of the coding languages, preferably Python
* Experience with working with GIT
* Experience in managing one’s own Git tool (Github/Azure Devops/Gitlab) pages


What’s in it for you?* Joining an international company with a Benelux family culture #OneSamsung
* Several development programs and initiatives to upskill your career (Samsung University, young talent & leadership programs, digital & data academy, coaching, job skills trainings, …) #DoWhatYouCan’t
* Internal mobility opportunities to advance your career (you are in a sales role, and have an interest in marketing? We support you to establish that transfer successfully)
* Health & Wellbeing program (we have our own fitness on site in The Netherlands + Belgium and organize online and offline health initiatives because we care about your wellbeing).
* Competitive compensation & benefits package to reward you for your work in supporting our company to grow


About us
Our story begins in 1969, when Samsung saw the light of day with the ambition to help people achieve the impossible. After more than 50 years, we are still innovating and creating boundless technology that helps people make the impossible possible. We remain driven by our purpose, which is why we put people and what they care about at the center of everything we create.
We do this by staying true to our global values.* Human experiences (We put people first, at the center of everything we do).
* Progressive Innovation (We are constantly finding new ways to improve the way people live by creating inventive products and services).
* Rebellious Optimism (We challenge ourselves and the status quo to change the world).
* Integrity & transparency (We always strive to do the right thing by being open and honest with our customers and partner ecosystem).
* Social improvement (We believe that technology should benefit everyone. It should be accessible, sustainable and used for good).

title: Solutions Engineer - ESG & Sustainability
description:
As part of Workiva's Growth Solutions team, the Solutions Engineer is at the forefront of defining new solutions on the Workiva platform. This role is focused on exploring new markets, ideating and iterating on a solution design, and defining the best practices for all selected new solutions or use cases on our platform.
The Solutions Engineer supports the process of incubating new solutions and use cases cross-functionally. Together with other global, internal teams including sales, solution engineering, product, technical solutioning, marketing, and the services organization, the Solution Engineer is committed to develop best-in-class solutions on the Workiva platform.
As part of Workiva’s Growth Solutions team's current initiatives, the Solutions Engineer will also provide pre-sales support in the development and presentation of our ESG and Sustainability solution specifically for customers to address the complex problems that Workiva's platform and solutions solve.
What You’ll Do* Organize, ideate, and iterate on and utilizes existing and new Workiva platform functionality to develop new applications of our platform under the direction of Growth Solutions leadership and Senior / Principal Solution Engineers
* Stay informed of industry trends, competitive landscapes, and regulatory changes to identify opportunities and threats and translate these insights into actionable marketing plans and opportunities for Workiva
* Support sales efforts as needed by joining sales meetings and lending perspectives on pricing and solution licensing, and identify trends and opportunities for broader sales enablement training
* Engage in Pre-sales Engagements by working directly with prospects to field-test solution design and set accurate expectations about the delivery process
* Consult with Workiva team members as needed to support understanding of Workiva customers and the technology they use while identifying potential Workiva solution gaps and expansion opportunities
* Proactively engage with Product Development teams -draft requirements, iterate on new Workiva platform functionality, and field tests with clients
* Maintain and enhance knowledge of processes related to the solution in incubation through a commitment to ongoing self-guided or Workiva-provided training
* Proactively engage with Product Marketing, Client Services, Scoping, and Customer Success to achieve team and company goals, as well as ensure post-sales delivery expectations are met


What You'll Need
Minimum Qualifications* Undergraduate Degree or equivalent combination of education and experience in a related field
* 4+ years of related career experience in client-facing software implementation or implementation service delivery


Preferred Qualifications* ESG/Sustainability Reporting background or related advisory experience
* Carbon Accounting and GHG Protocol experience (ideally 1+ years of experience in GHG accounting; Scopes 1 and 2 at a minimum with Scope 3 being a plus) and creation of sustainability reports.
* Carbon consulting experience and / or development of decarbonization strategies will be considered a plus
* Experience with Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP), Carbon Accounting or similar Analytics & Reporting platforms
* Excellent presentation skills - ability to present topics clearly and succinctly to various audiences (internal and external)
* Be committed to learning new concepts, new regulations and industry best practices within a fast-paced, high-performance consulting environment
* Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
* Self-motivated with a strong propensity for action, results, and continuous improvement
* Ability to influence and drive change in business processes
* A strong individual contributor with intellectual curiosity to positively impact the ability to manage multiple initiatives
* Have strong analytical, technical, and database management skills and be comfortable managing and analyzing large data sets with high attention to detail


Working Conditions & Travel Requirements* Up to 30% travel for customer meetings and company events
* Reliable internet access for any period of time working remotely, not in a Workiva office.


Workiva is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe that great minds think differently. We value diversity of backgrounds, beliefs, and interests, and we recognize diversity as an important source of intellectual thought, varied perspective, and innovation. Employment decisions are made without regard to age, gender identity, race, religion, disability status, sexual orientation, or any other protected characteristic.
Workiva is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. To request assistance with the application process, please email talentacquisition@workiva.com.
Workiva employees are required to undergo comprehensive security and privacy training tailored to their roles, ensuring adherence to company policies and regulatory standards.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
**Revolutionizing access to medical treatments**



We're on a mission to enable earlier and better access to treatments and improve the lives of patients. Making it possible for anyone to find and access the best possible treatment options, with the click of a button. Bringing together demand and supply like never before, in one of the world's largest industries. Our patient-centered offering is gaining traction, and with the right team we can go from helping thousands of patients to millions of patients access new treatments each year. Do you aspire to be at the forefront of patient-centric innovation and creating the next unicorn? You’ve come to the right place!

 **The opportunity: Senior Data Engineer**



As a Senior Data Engineer at myTomorrows, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the data infrastructure that underpins our innovative product platform. Working alongside our Data Analyst, Medical Data Scientist, and DevOps team, you will design and build a robust data environment that enables seamless data flow, storage, and visualization. This critical infrastructure will support the delivery of actionable insights and business intelligence to our customers and internal stakeholders through intuitive dashboards and reports.  

  

In this key position, you will collaborate closely with the Product and Engineering team, as well as the Growth department and other stakeholders, to identify and address the complex data challenges that arise in the development of our product. Your expertise will be instrumental in ensuring that our data collection, storage, and reporting capabilities meet the evolving needs of our business, ultimately driving growth, innovation, and success.

  

We are looking for candidates who are willing to join our team in our Amsterdam office up to 2 days a week, where they'll have the opportunity to work alongside our dynamic and dedicated colleagues. This hybrid setup allows for flexibility, autonomy, and the chance to build strong relationships with your teammates. If you're a motivated and collaborative individual who thrives in a fast-paced environment, we'd love to hear from you!

 **What you'll do in this role**:


* You will work within our engineering and product team working closely with Marketing and Growth teams to develop reporting pipelines
* Design and construct robust reporting pipelines that deliver actionable insights to business stakeholders.
* Develop and maintain scalable and reliable data architectures for reporting purposes.
* Collaborate with business analysts to understand reporting requirements and deliver comprehensive solutions.
* Ensure compliance with industry standards and best practices for healthcare data management
* Stay up to date with the latest trends and technologies in data engineering and data quality assurance

  


  

  

**What you bring to the table:**


* Experience in building and maintaining modern data pipelines with Python, DBT and ETL tools like Airbyte
* Experience with loading and transforming data from various data sources like HubSpot, Google Analytics, RDMS (MySQL, PostgreSQL) and NoSQL databases like DynamoDB and various formats
* Experience with data visualization tooling like Tableau
* Experience with data modeling and data architecture
* Working understanding of software development lifecycles and agile methodologies
* Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to collaborate efficiently in a small data team with a data analyst and medical data scientist
* Excellent English communication skills

**Current tech stack**



We are fully cloud-native utilizing AWS. We adopt a Lean, API first product development approach leveraging cloud technologies and design practices.



Our platform technologies, both microservice and AI, are developed in Python.



We also foster a rapidly growing expertise in knowledge graphs (Neo4j, Memgraph) and database technologies (SQL, NoSQL restful etc.). In addition, we develop human in the loop Machine learning for healthcare in house such as LLMs and other NLP techniques.

 **What we offer**


* Serve a purposeful mission: helping patients gain access to potentially lifesaving treatments
* International work environment, scale-up energy, and flat organization
* Competitive salary, annual performance bonus, and equity
* Great career development opportunities in a growing company
* Learning and development budget, alongside internal knowledge sharing sessions
* Attractive pension plan, full premium covered by us
* Hybrid work model
* Policies to support working parents
* Healthy lunch at the office
* Unlimited access to professional guidance by certified psychologists via OpenUp
* We celebrate freedom every year with an added holiday for Liberation Day on the 5th of May


**Who we are**



myTomorrows aims to break barriers for eligible patients seeking information about clinical trials and support referrals to trial sites. When patients are not eligible for clinical studies, we help them and their physicians to navigate the complexities of expanded access programs.


We are an ambitious, values-driven HealthTech company that empowers patients and physicians to discover and access clinical treatments in development – so tomorrow’s treatments can reach those who need it today. Wherever you are, whichever role you play, you’ll share each & every day with committed, inspired and innovative teammates.



myTomorrows is an Equal Opportunity Employer and, beyond upholding discrimination-free practices, we are committed to cultivating a workplace where difference and diversity are protected and celebrated. The best work comes from our best selves and we go to great lengths in supporting our team members to be just that.



myTomorrows | The Explainer Video
