title: Senior Software Performance Engineer (Android/Kotlin)
description:
**You will play a pivotal role in improving the performance, reliability, and transparency of the TomTom** **Navigation SDK****, through collaboration and alignment across multiple teams within the organization.**
### **What you'll do**

* Provide automated system-level measurements and benchmarks for performance regression detection, leading to early identification and resolution of performance issues
* Enable the production of product KPIs aligned with customer expectations and product management requirements, enhancing transparency and driving product improvements
* Design, build and operate a framework for meaningful data consumption measurements, allowing for informed decision-making on the impact of various choices on data consumption for specific scenarios
* Lead the effort to create a common/shared solution for data consumption measurements, fostering collaboration across teams and driving the development of a dedicated framework
* Manage the performance benchmark framework for regression detection on the component level, ensuring that performance regressions in components are detected early and actionable results are provided to the respective teams
* Own the publishing of test results to dashboards, providing stakeholders with clear and accessible visualizations of benchmark results

### **What you'll need**

* **Android Development**: Understanding of Android framework and development tools
* **SDK Development**: Experience in SDK development and understanding of its impact on system performance
* **Hardware Configuration Knowledge:** Understanding of different hardware configurations and their impact on system-level measurements
* **Profiling and Performance Optimization**: Experience in analyzing system-level performance, identifying bottlenecks, and optimizing performance
* **Scripting and Automation**: Ability to automate the execution of benchmarks and measurements
* **Collaboration and Communication**: Capable of working with product management to align benchmarks with product KPIs and effectively communicate results

### **What's nice to have**

* Regression Detection: Familiarity with implementing automated regression detection for performance benchmarks at both system and component levels
* Benchmarking: Knowledge of creating and running performance benchmarks for system-level measurements, including component-level benchmarks
* Dashboard Integration: Experience in publishing test results to Grafana or similar dashboards, including data visualization and dashboard integration
* Data Consumption Measurements: Experience in designing and implementing frameworks for data consumption measurements, including the ability to run tests on emulators without limitation
* Data Analysis Skills: Ability to analyze benchmark results and identify performance trends or anomalies, especially for data consumption measurements
* Quality Assurance: Familiarity with ensuring the reliability and accuracy of performance measurements, including the component-level benchmarks
* Customer Focus: Understanding of customer expectations and ability to align benchmarks with customer use cases for product KPIs
* Collaboration and Communication: Ability to effectively communicate benchmark results through dashboard visualizations to stakeholders

 **What we offer**  

A competitive compensation package, of course.  

Time and resources to grow and develop, including a personal development budget and paid leave for learning days, as well as paid access to e-learning resources such as O’Reilly and LinkedIn Learning.  

Time to support life outside of work, with enhanced parental leave plus paid leave to care for loved ones and volunteer in local communities.  

Work from home, the office, or even abroad – each team has the flexibility to choose how they work based on business needs.  

Improve your home office with a setup budget and get extra support with a monthly allowance.  

Enjoy options to work from your home country and abroad for a set number of days each year, to visit family and friends, or to simply explore the world we’re mapping.  

Take the holidays you want with a competitive holiday plan, plus an extra day off to celebrate your birthday.  

Join annual events like our Hackathon and DevDays to bring your ideas to life with talented teammates from around the world.  

Become a part of our inclusive global culture and have the chance to collaborate with a diverse community – we have over 80 nationalities at TomTom!  

Find out more about our global benefits and enjoy additional local benefits tailored to your location. **Meet your team**  

We are the Map Visualization Product Unit. We develop map rendering technology that can be integrated into navigation systems and location-based applications, providing our technology to our customers in the form of cloud-based APIs and SDKs.  

We see quality-management processes as a source of competitive advantage. As part of our product-led and outcome-oriented culture, we believe it is crucial to have mechanisms in place to measure and improve the quality of our products in a continuous manner so we can achieve our mission of mapping the world in real time. **At TomTom...**  

You’ll help people find their way in the world. In 2004, TomTom revolutionized how the world moves with the introduction of the first portable navigation device. Now, we intend to do it again by engineering the first-ever real-time map, the smartest and most useful map on the planet.  

Work with a team of 3,700 unique, curious and passionate problem-solvers. Together, we’ll open up a world of possibilities for car manufacturers, enterprises and developers to help people understand and get closer to the world around them. **After you apply**  

Our recruitment team will work hard to give you a meaningful experience throughout your journey with us, no matter the outcome. Your application will be screened closely and you can rest assured that all follow-up actions will be thorough, from assessments and interviews all the way through onboarding. To find out more about our application process, check out our hiring FAQs. **TomTom is an equal opportunity employer**  

TomTom is where you can find your place in the world. Every day we welcome, nurture and celebrate differences. Why? Because your uniqueness is what makes you, *you*. No matter your culture or background, you’ll find your impact at TomTom. Research also shows that sometimes women and underrepresented communities can be hesitant to apply for positions unless they believe they meet 100% of the criteria. If you can relate to this, please know that we’d love to hear from you.
company_description: At TomTom, we want to engineer the first real-time map. You might think it has been done before but it hasn't. Help us make it happen – become a mapmaking trailblazer.

title: Data Scientist
description:
**Company Description**  

Avery Dennison Corporation (NYSE: AVY) is a global materials science and digital identification solutions company that provides a wide range of branding and information solutions that optimize labor and supply chain efficiency, reduce waste, advance sustainability, circularity and transparency, and better connect brands and consumers. Our products and solutions include labeling and functional materials, radio frequency identification (RFID) inlays and tags, software applications that connect the physical and digital, and a variety of products and solutions that enhance branded packaging and carry or display information that improves the customer experience. Serving an array of industries worldwide — including home and personal care, apparel, general retail, e-commerce, logistics, food and grocery, pharmaceuticals and automotive — we employ approximately 35,000 employees in more than 50 countries. Our reported sales in 2023 were $8.4 billion. Learn more at www.averydennison.com.

**Avery Dennison is an equal opportunity employer.**  

Please let us know if we can support you with reasonable accommodations throughout the application process by contacting our team via Requestaccomodation@eu.averydennison.com.

 **Job Description** **ABOUT YOUR ROLE:**

**The Data Scientist will be joining the European Materials Group Finance team and will work on some of the most interesting and challenging business problems, with the goal to to drive better business insights, improve efficiency and unlock value for our customers. In this role you will interact with business leaders across functions and engage the business in data-driven debates.**

**You will utilize your skills and experience to systematically answer questions using data to provide actionable recommendations. You will commonly utilize advanced statistical analysis and machine learning techniques. You will be responsible for modeling complex problems, discovering insights and identifying opportunities through the use of statistical, algorithmic, mining and visualization techniques. A successful candidate will have demonstrated experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations, such that they can efficiently and effectively develop solutions to a broad array of use cases.**

**YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES WILL INCLUDE:**

* **Interpreting and analyzing data using exploratory mathematic and statistical techniques based on the scientific method**
* **Formulating and leading guided, multifaceted analytic studies against large volumes of data**
* **Coordinating research and analytic activities utilizing various data points unstructured and structured and employ programming to clean, massage, and organize the data**
* **Analyzing problems and determining root causes**
* **Translating complex results into simple, clear conclusions and visualizations**
* **Explaining sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner**
* **Defining company data assets, data models, and jobs to populate data models**
* **Working closely with all European business units and cross functional teams to develop future models with the ability to link results to business processes**
* **Coordinating with Data Engineers to build data environments providing data identified by Knowledge Managers and Analysts**
* **Experimenting against data points, providing information based on experiment results and providing previously undiscovered solutions to command data challenges**

 **Qualifications** **WHAT WE WILL BE LOOKING FOR IN YOU:**

* **Bachelor’s, Master’s degree (preferred), or other advanced degree required in computer science, business analytics, applied mathematics, statistics, machine learning, or other data centric discipline**
* **4+ years of relevant industry work experience providing advanced analytics solutions, with a focus on Forecasting based models.**
* **Proficiency with one or more programming languages: Java, NodeJS, Python, R**
* **Knowledgeable in some Cloud and Big Data technologies, such as Microsoft Azure, Azure Data Lake, Databricks, Google Cloud Platform, Apache Spark**
* **Analytics skills: descriptive statistical modeling & algorithms, machine learning algorithms, modeling dataset building, optimization, data visualization, pattern/cluster/segmentation analysis, predictive analytics, Analytics tools and Technologies like Qlikview, Cognos, Visual Basic, Apache, Oracle, SQL, GraphQL, NoSQL**
* **Exceptional record of academic achievement, professional accomplishment, project management, and leadership**
* **Passion for building and comfort working with modern development tools and writing code collaboratively (bonus points if you have a software development or DevOps experience)**
* **Advanced analytical knowledge of data, ability to conduct big data analysis, data conditioning experience, programming advanced computing skill**
* **Additional experience in core analytic methods such as predictive modeling and customer and product segmentation/clustering**
* **Business sense: Basic knowledge of finance, manufacturing and commercial business processes and ability to translate business needs into data and explain complex concepts in an understandable manner**
* **Project lead experience of cross functional teams is strongly preferred**

 **Additional Information** **We offer:**

* Attractive salary package
* Workplace & work hours flexibility
* Structured learning and development / Mentoring program
* International environment
* Events such as International Women’s Day, Earth Day, etc.
* A growing and welcoming team with good spirit!

**Who we are! - Our Story:**

**Every voice. Every day!** **Eight Values****. One Team!**


Being open to every voice, every day, brings our value of diversity to life and makes Avery Dennison a vibrant and engaging place to be. We understand diversity and equal opportunities as enrichment for our future-oriented work. Across our diverse, global team, every voice makes us stronger. When we listen to and learn from each other, there is no limit to what we can achieve together. Each of us is unique, and we appreciate bringing together different personalities and talents.


Avery Dennison is an equal-opportunity employer. In the **EMEA region**, we have these **Employee Resource Groups**:

* **EmpoWer** - focusing on the engagement, mentoring, and promotion of women
* **Mental Health** - striving to provide a safe space for employees to discuss mental health issues in the workplace
* **Unite** - supporting the LGBTQI+ and ally community in the EMEA region


To find out more about **all our employee resources groups globally** as well as our **Diversity, Equity & Inclusion** approach, please go to our Diversity and Inclusion pages in the About Us section of our website: https://www.averydennison.com/en/home/about-us/diversity-and-inclusion.html


At Avery Dennison, we do what we love, and we love what we do - Just click here, and get to know us better: **Life @ Avery Dennison** (linkedin.com/company/avery-dennison/life/emea)
company_description: Materials science is in our DNA. The pursuit of our vision has aligned our businesses into a focused, customer-driven company that specializes in materials science.

title: Agri-Food Data Intern
description:
**Company Description**  

SNV is a mission-driven global development partner working in more than 20 countries across Africa and Asia. Building on 60 years of experience and grounded in the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development, we work on the core themes of gender equality and social inclusion, climate adaptation and mitigation, and strong institutions and effective governance. Together with our team of over 1,600 people, our mission is to strengthen capacities and catalyse partnerships that transform the agri-food, energy, and water systems, which enable sustainable and more equitable lives for all.


Our core values of people-centeredness and respect, equity and equality, and diversity and inclusion, are fundamental to who we are, and what we do. This is reflected in our vision and mission, and strategy, which sets out our aspirations and commitments as our compass towards 2030.


For more information on SNV, please refer to our website: www.snv.org

 **Job Description** **Internship Description**  

Are you a student passionate about making a positive impact on the world? Do you want to gain valuable hands-on experience in the agri-food sector and international development? If so, an internship with SNV's Global Agri-Food Team (GATe) could be the perfect opportunity for you!

**What You'll Gain:**  

This internship provides a wealth of opportunities to enhance your skills and knowledge, including:

* **Developing strong data analysis skills** to generate actionable insights that drive real-world change in the agri-food sector.
* **Gaining hands-on experience** with data analysis tools and techniques.
* **Contributing to impactful projects** that promote sustainable agriculture and food security.
* **Working alongside experienced professionals** and learn from their expertise.
* **Building your international development network** in a diverse and collaborative team environment.


You will have the opportunity to gain valuable skills and knowledge while making a real contribution to our ongoing projects. We will work closely with you to align your tasks and activities with your specific learning objectives. This will ensure that you get the most out of your internship and really learn something that fits in with your future plan

**Tasks and activities:**

* Analyse qualitative data from diverse projects to assess their impact at scale.
* Assist with research and report writing (working papers, monitoring reports).
* Identify insights, trends, and opportunities for improving project design and delivery based on data analysis.
* Utilize data visualization tools to communicate complex findings effectively.
* Contribute to knowledge management activities and administrative tasks (as needed).

  

**Qualifications** **We're looking for a passionate student:**

* Enrolled in a Bachelor's or Master's program at an accredited EU university with a focus on fields pertinent to our work, like Data Science, Agriculture, or International Development
* Analytical skills and a passion for data
* Excellent written and spoken English communication skills
* Proactive, detail-oriented, and self-motivated
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook and Teams preferred)
* A desire to learn and contribute to a collaborative team environment

  

**Additional Information** **Our offer to you**  

As an intern at SNV, you will experience a hands-on and dynamic environment where you will have plenty of opportunities to learn, grow, and contribute to innovative projects. Our enthusiastic team is committed to developing your skills, fostering collaboration, and encouraging innovation." Here’s what we offer:

* **Internship agreement**: 4-6 month duration
* **Work schedule**: 24 to 32 hours per week
* **Allowance**: Gross €500 per month, plus reimbursement of public transport costs (if you are not able to use the public transport student card)
* **Flexible starting date**
* **International experience**: Work with colleagues from all over the world
* **Diverse working environment**: Opportunities to co-create, build, and innovate, with a strong commitment to developing your skills

**How to Apply**  

If you’re an enthusiastic student ready to dive into this exciting opportunity, we’d love to hear from you! We invite you to apply by submitting your CV with a motivation letter including the below details in English before/on Wednesday the 26th of June, 2024.


To ensure a smooth review process, we'd like to confirm a few details about your candidacy.

**Eligibility:**

* This internship is open to students currently enrolled in an accredited Dutch University. Can you confirm your enrolment and provide your expected graduation date?

**Internship goals:**

* Is this internship a requirement for your studies?
* What are your expected internship duration and your available hours per week?
* What are your learning objectives for this internship?


We value candidates who can share their goals and how this internship aligns with their academic journey. Answering these questions will help us assess if you're a good fit for this internship.

**Internship at SNV**  

SNV offers an enriching internship experience, providing a dynamic and challenging environment, where you can lead, innovate, and grow your skills. As an intern, you will be part of a diverse and fulfilling team, contributing to impactful projects and collaborating with a global network of experts. For more information, please visit our website: www.snv.org.


At SNV, inclusivity is at the heart of our ethos. We celebrate the diversity of our workforce and uphold a policy of non-discrimination based on factors such as disability status, religion, ethnic origin, gender, sexual orientation, and more.

title: Senior Market Intelligence Analyst
description:
In this role, you will be central to producing high-quality insights and foresights to our customers to support strategy execution and development. The insights are delivered to our customers through our Market Intelligence platform and in quarterly and yearly sessions in which you will have a big role.


Do you enjoy and enjoy translating data into actionable insights and foresights, and are you an experienced Project Manager?


Read on!

##### **What You'll Be Doing:**

* Analyze diverse data sources such as annual reports and trade databases to uncover key trends that inform strategic decisions.
* Work with the customer and Market Intelligence Analyst team to structure and execute workstreams as a Project Manager.
* Ensure the highest data accuracy and continuously enhance our insight generation processes.
* Use your expertise to forecast trends and integrate foresights into client strategies, guiding their decision-making.
* Simplify complex data into actionable insights during workshops and client presentations, influencing strategic directions.
* Craft intuitive models and visualizations that support data-driven decisions for our team and clients.


‍

###### **Projects You’ll Work On:**

* **Market Assessments:** Assess the market potential for key segments within large agricultural and food companies, leveraging both public and proprietary data to support strategic planning and investment decisions.
* **Competitive Benchmarking:** Conduct in-depth competitive reviews for major food customers, synthesizing data into strategic recommendations that are presented to senior management.


‍

###### **What Success Looks Like:**

* **First 30 Days:** Familiarize yourself with our company culture, data systems, and client profiles to effectively integrate into our team.
* **First 90 Days:** Enhance your skills to actively engage in and contribute to quarterly customer discussions, aligning your efforts with our strategic goals.
* **First 180 Days:** Take charge of preparing content for customer workshops and leading project workstreams in market and competitor analysis, showcasing your growing independence and expertise.


‍

###### **Challenges:**

* **Data Management:** Process and refine extensive datasets efficiently to maintain data integrity and ensure the insights generated are actionable.
* **Learning Curve:** Quickly adapt to the complexities of our operational and analytical tools, becoming proficient in their use.


‍

###### **Key Performance Indicators (KPIs):**

* **Insight Quality:** Measure the effectiveness of insights through customer feedback and their impact on client decision-making processes.


‍

##### **Your Talent:**

* An independent thinker with a strong analytical mindset, eager to take on challenges and drive results.
* Strong communication skills, capable of explaining complex data in understandable terms.
* Skilled in Excel, experience with visualization tools and data analytics tools is a pré (Python, Power BI, and SQL).
* Demonstrable experience managing complex projects and stakeholders efficiently.
* Proven ability to handle complex datasets and generate meaningful business insights.
* The ideal candidate will likely have between 2 to 5 years of experience, and a degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics or similar fields.


‍

##### **Who you'll be working with:**


Miriam
Head of Insights & Strategic Services
Mathieu
Associate
Jurre
Junior Analyst
‍

##### **What We Offer:**

* A competitive salary range of €47,000 - €60,000 annually, which includes an 8% holiday bonus.
* Performance bonus of up to 10% of your gross salary.
* A hybrid work setup where you can balance working from home with 2-5 days in the office per week.
* Regular company events like dinners, BBQs, boat trips, and padel tournaments, fostering a vibrant team culture.
##### **A-INSIGHTS**


A-INSIGHTS is the fastest growing company and market intelligence platform in the market. Trusted and loved by some of the world's largest companies (Bayer, McCain, Ahold, RoyalFrieslandCampina, Gemeente Amsterdam), we combine worldwide publicly available company and market data with the latest domain & tech expertise.


Our goal is to set the international standard for objective company performance insights based on publicly available data.


And our journey is just getting started!


Every day, we make it easy for organizations around the world to make a difference through best-in-class insights and unmatched service. And we don’t plan on stopping anytime soon.


We are building a team of passionate and talented people who are eager to contribute to this growth and help us write our story.


‍

##### **Application Process:**

* **Screening Call:** Kick off your application with a screening call from our recruiter to discuss your background and fit for the role.
* **Online Skill-Based Assessment**
* **In-Person Interview:** If successful in the initial stages, you'll be invited to our Amsterdam office for an in-depth interview to further assess your fit with our team and culture.


‍

###### **Ready to Apply?**


If this role excites you, don't hesitate—apply today via our careers page! Research indicates that some groups, particularly women, are less likely to apply for jobs unless they meet every qualification. If you're passionate about joining us but don't meet all the criteria, we still encourage you to apply. We're excited to see how your unique skills might contribute to our team at A-Insights.


‍

**Have Questions?** For any inquiries or additional information, please contact Iselde van Beurden, Interim Talent Lead, at:

* Email: Iselde@theentrepreneurials.com
* Whatsapp: +31 (0)638276027
Got questions about this job?

title: Data & Space Analyst Space Management
description:
**Introduction**  



Do you want to take pride in enabling the rapid growth that ASML is facing by supporting the development, construction and maintenance of high quality real estate and facilities? Then working with us at ASML Corporate Real Estate must sound as a great opportunity to you.  

  



Our Corporate Real Estate (CRE) Netherlands department is responsible for all CRE activities/responsibilities for the Netherlands portfolio and ensure alignment with CRE strategy, business continuity and operational excellence in accordance with CRE’s foundational elements.  



  

The Space & Data Analyst is responsible for supporting the Space Management & Facility Management team for the performance on the defined KPI’s. As a Data Analyst in the Space Management Team the main objective is to collect, analyze, and interpret data related to the housing and workplace experience of ASML’s employees in The Netherlands.


**Roles and responsibilities**

The role of the Space & Data Analyst entails the following key responsibilities:


* Key Responsibilities
* Collecting data related to housing and workplace experience metrics such as occupancy rates, utilization rates, and employee satisfaction scores
* Collect, organize, and combine (structured and unstructured) data and transfer it into management information and insights.
* Data Analytics of global performance relating to Housing & Workplace Experience, incl. workplace analysis, surveys and internal and external benchmarking to identify improvement areas
* Developing and maintaining data dashboards, reports, and visualizations to communicate insights to key stakeholders in collaboration with the Data & Applications team
* Conducting data quality checks to ensure accuracy and completeness of data
* Performing ad-hoc analysis and deep dives to uncover trends and provide insights to support business decisions
* Providing recommendations and insights based on data analysis to support the development of strategic plans for the housing and workplace experience
* Staying up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and workplace experience management
* Improve overall space related data quality and reporting (NL organization).
* Support on further optimization of the data management structure, dashboarding and tooling.
* Support the development of the NL Masterplan (Space planning responsibility) by providing relevant data analysis related to space utilization, trend analysis and real estate insights.
* Discover, interpretate, and communicate meaningful patterns in data, combining different data sources.
* Support the team members in setting up work files and reporting formats.
* Perform (automatic) analysis, create reports, modelling, and create strategic solutions
* In cooperation with the Data Steward as counterpart for collection, retrieving data and its quality.

**Complexity**

* Ability to successfully navigate the high degree of ambiguity and ever-changing demands of our internal stakeholders
* Manage relationships with regional space planners
* Ability to operate in a high impact, fast-paced environment, while maintaining composure under deadline pressure.

**Education and experience**

* Bachelor / Master degree in business management, hospitality management, facility manage or similar.
* At least 5-10 years of similar experience in housing space management, scenario and demand management.

**Skills**  



Working at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. You’ll have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems.
  

  

To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:


*Core competencies*

* Relevant Master degree, e.g., Real Estate, Business Administration, Data Science.
* Experience in working with data analysis tools and techniques.
* Preferably experience in working in the (corporate) real estate sector.
* 5-10+ years of relevant experience.
* Academic working level obtained by education and work experience.
* Experience in gathering and analyzing information in a fast-paced international network organization.

*Functional competencies*

* Strong interpersonal and relationship building skills, including the ability to build trust and understanding
* Proactive, data orientated, organized mindset, and result-driven
* Strong oral and written communication skills as well as creativity, attention to detail, and analytical skills
* Multicultural awareness: accepts and respects other norms, value, beliefs and cultures

**Other information**  



**Context of the position**

Reports to: Manager Space Planning
  

Manages: No direct/indirect reports
  

Interfaces: Housing Solution Specialists, Data Analysts, CRE NL Business Partners, REDS, CRE CoE.

(Please take some time to really think about your cover letter, as this is the perfect opportunity to present yourself for our Hiring Managers)

title: Data Analyst, Operational Services
HR Manager
description:
**Your Job**
INVISTA is currently seeking a Human Resources Manager to lead HR initiatives at our Rozenburg, NL facility. The chosen candidate will be instrumental in enhancing our talent strategy and promoting organizational effectiveness within our manufacturing operations. Reporting to the Human Resources Director, the Human Resources Manager will work closely with site leadership and employees to bolster performance, build capabilities, foster a constructive workplace culture, offer guidance and coaching, ensure robust employee and union relations, and promote our Principle Based Management culture. The HR Manager will be responsible for implementing HR strategies, including the development and execution of plans to attract, develop, and retain the talent essential for achieving our organizational objectives. The ideal candidate will possess a comprehensive HR background, proven relationship-building skills, and the ability to align with business goals. We are looking for a self-driven individual with excellent interpersonal skills, a commitment to assisting others, and a desire to generate significant value. If you are eager to contribute and grow with us, we welcome you to apply.

**What You Will Do**  

  



* Partner with manufacturing plant leadership to advance vision and strategies
* Coach and partner with site leaders to drive results and advance our culture
* Provide guidance to leaders on change management and employee development
* Drive innovation to include automation of transactional HR work and leverage shared capabilities across the business
* Ensure policies and practices meet employment and labour compliance requirements
* Strategically focus on attracting, selecting, developing, and retaining contribution motivated individuals
* Establish and maintain a positive work environment for all employees
* Investigate and address employee relations matters
* Deliver HR assistance to our remote workforce, predominantly located in Germany and the UK

**Who You Are (Basic Qualifications)**  

  



* Demonstrated experience working in a Human Resources role
* Proven experience partnering with business leadership to develop and execute strategies
* Experience coaching and developing leadership capability

**What Will Put You Ahead**  

  



* Bachelor's degree in human resources, business, or other related discipline
* Experience with HR processes (selection, performance management, talent planning, change management, etc.) in a manufacturing environment
* Experience with works council processes and unionized collective labour agreement (CLA)
* Supervisor experience
* Experience creating data visualizations

At Koch companies, we are entrepreneurs. This means we openly challenge the status quo, find new ways to create value and get rewarded for our individual contributions. Any compensation range provided for a role is an estimate determined by available market data. The actual amount may be higher or lower than the range provided considering each candidate's knowledge, skills, abilities, and geographic location. If you have questions, please speak to your recruiter about the flexibility and detail of our compensation philosophy.

**Who We Are**


As a Koch company, INVISTA has a long history of working to make the world around you a better place. From parts for the automotive industry to medical equipment, air bags, food packaging and clothing, our ingredients in the nylon 6,6 and polypropylene value chains help bring many of life's essential products to market.


At Koch, employees are empowered to do what they do best to make life better. Learn how our business philosophy helps employees unleash their potential while creating value for themselves and the company.


Additionally, everyone has individual work and personal needs. We seek to enable the best work environment that helps you and the business work together to produce superior results.


#LI-BZ1
company_description: At INVISTA, we make the chemicals, polymers, fabrics and fibers that can handle life’s toughest demands.

title: Senior BI Developer
description:
Position Summary
The BI Developer is responsible in developing the BI solutions such as a self-service dashboard by engineering data pipelines and workflows, translating business requirements into technical solutions with hands-on skills in visualizations. You communicate with various stakeholders such as the Business units, marketing department, BI functions, support functions and other teams in Data and Analytics.
Role and Responsibilities
Stakeholder management* Collaborate with Business Owners, Data engineers, Business Analysts and Data Scientists to align business requirements with data
* Map requirements and projects from stakeholders, including Business Divisions, Marketing Channel experts, and Marketing Strategy teams.
* Establish collaboration with European and global teams working on BI and Analytics projects
* Evangelize the data-driven decision-making to the stakeholders while communicating in a plain and intuitive language so that stakeholders easily follow even the sophisticated and technical concepts.
* Train and guide stakeholders how to use BI tools and solutions


Data Visualization and reports creation* Create and maintain the automatic reporting work processes (Sales, marketing, Ops, etc)
* Manage the automated/self-serving data visualization projects by building the foundation layer for dashboard reporting.
* Convert data into a suitable graphic format including - dashboards, graphs, charts, and reports using BI tools (Power BI)
* Develop and manage BI extension tool for user interaction, such as PowerApps
* Automate reporting in the BI tool via paginated reports in PowerBI or PowerAutomate
* Robotic Process Automation in generating the standards marketing performance reports
* Handling ad-hoc report or data requests


Data Engineering* Collect and connect data from different sources according to a business's needs, use cases, potential exploitation and deployment, and technology possibilities: GCP, Azure, and local servers.
* Model raw data into clean, tested, and reusable datasets, make it easier for business analysts and other stakeholders to view and understand data in DB, with a data engineer or standalone
* Apply various and automated transformations (ETL, ELT) to different data pieces to ensure they correspond to given tasks  

removing inaccurate or corrupted data
* Perform (and Guide juniors) maintenance and troubleshooting activities for data engineering and BI tools.


Data infrastructure and governance support* Support Data warehouse governance and access management
* Recommend strategies to improve performance and capacity of BI tools.
* Support and advise in developing security and authentication standards for the department and users.
* Maintain accurate and complete technical architecture documents.
* Support in defining BI standards, guidelines and best practices for business groups and technical teams.


Your team
You will be part of the Central Data Analytics team in Schiphol, Netherlands. We are providing marketing and business analytics solutions as well as the consumer, market, and business insights. You will be part of the BI team, one of the critical pillars of Data & Analytics success at Samsung. Your team consists of data engineers, BI & visualization developers, and closely works with the Advanced Analytics team.
Skills and Qualifications
Your skills and qualifications
 (Requirements)
As a BI Developer you have the following qualification(s):* Bachelor or Master degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Econometrics, Business Information Management, or an equivalent study
* 5+ years of experience working in BI, Dashboard development, or Analytics
* Proven Technical Experience in ETL and relational data base management, and data modeling using the following tools: Python, SQL, Big Query
* Hands-on skills in data visualization tools (Power BI/ Tableau/Looker), preferably PowerBI.
* Knowledge and hands-on skills in data engineering, API, and cloud computing (GCP, Azure, and Databricks)
* English proficiency
* Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects, and forge strong interpersonal relationships within the department, with other departments, and with external audiences.
* Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills to effectively communicate information to all levels within the organization
* Excellent networking, project management, and organizational skills
* Excellent OA software skills such as Excel, Word, and Powerpoint


Preferred qualifications
The ideal BI Developer recognize themselves in the following profile:
(Advantages)* Skills in PowerApps and PowerAutomate are a huge plus
* Skills in Robotic Process Automation (RPA) and Web scraping are a huge plus.
* Knowledge in Statistics, Econometrics and Machine Learning is a huge plus
* Knowledge and hands-on skills in Machine learning engineering are a huge plus
* Experience with SQL performance tuning and E2E process optimization
* Experience with Airflow
* Experience with designing and implementing real-time data pipelines
* Strong knowledge in one of the coding languages, preferably Python
* Experience with working with GIT
* Experience in managing one’s own Git tool (Github/Azure Devops/Gitlab) pages


What’s in it for you?* Joining an international company with a Benelux family culture #OneSamsung
* Several development programs and initiatives to upskill your career (Samsung University, young talent & leadership programs, digital & data academy, coaching, job skills trainings, …) #DoWhatYouCan’t
* Internal mobility opportunities to advance your career (you are in a sales role, and have an interest in marketing? We support you to establish that transfer successfully)
* Health & Wellbeing program (we have our own fitness on site in The Netherlands + Belgium and organize online and offline health initiatives because we care about your wellbeing).
* Competitive compensation & benefits package to reward you for your work in supporting our company to grow


About us
Our story begins in 1969, when Samsung saw the light of day with the ambition to help people achieve the impossible. After more than 50 years, we are still innovating and creating boundless technology that helps people make the impossible possible. We remain driven by our purpose, which is why we put people and what they care about at the center of everything we create.
We do this by staying true to our global values.* Human experiences (We put people first, at the center of everything we do).
* Progressive Innovation (We are constantly finding new ways to improve the way people live by creating inventive products and services).
* Rebellious Optimism (We challenge ourselves and the status quo to change the world).
* Integrity & transparency (We always strive to do the right thing by being open and honest with our customers and partner ecosystem).
* Social improvement (We believe that technology should benefit everyone. It should be accessible, sustainable and used for good).

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
**Revolutionizing access to medical treatments**



We're on a mission to enable earlier and better access to treatments and improve the lives of patients. Making it possible for anyone to find and access the best possible treatment options, with the click of a button. Bringing together demand and supply like never before, in one of the world's largest industries. Our patient-centered offering is gaining traction, and with the right team we can go from helping thousands of patients to millions of patients access new treatments each year. Do you aspire to be at the forefront of patient-centric innovation and creating the next unicorn? You’ve come to the right place!

 **The opportunity: Senior Data Engineer**



As a Senior Data Engineer at myTomorrows, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the data infrastructure that underpins our innovative product platform. Working alongside our Data Analyst, Medical Data Scientist, and DevOps team, you will design and build a robust data environment that enables seamless data flow, storage, and visualization. This critical infrastructure will support the delivery of actionable insights and business intelligence to our customers and internal stakeholders through intuitive dashboards and reports.  

  

In this key position, you will collaborate closely with the Product and Engineering team, as well as the Growth department and other stakeholders, to identify and address the complex data challenges that arise in the development of our product. Your expertise will be instrumental in ensuring that our data collection, storage, and reporting capabilities meet the evolving needs of our business, ultimately driving growth, innovation, and success.

  

We are looking for candidates who are willing to join our team in our Amsterdam office up to 2 days a week, where they'll have the opportunity to work alongside our dynamic and dedicated colleagues. This hybrid setup allows for flexibility, autonomy, and the chance to build strong relationships with your teammates. If you're a motivated and collaborative individual who thrives in a fast-paced environment, we'd love to hear from you!

 **What you'll do in this role**:


* You will work within our engineering and product team working closely with Marketing and Growth teams to develop reporting pipelines
* Design and construct robust reporting pipelines that deliver actionable insights to business stakeholders.
* Develop and maintain scalable and reliable data architectures for reporting purposes.
* Collaborate with business analysts to understand reporting requirements and deliver comprehensive solutions.
* Ensure compliance with industry standards and best practices for healthcare data management
* Stay up to date with the latest trends and technologies in data engineering and data quality assurance

  


  

  

**What you bring to the table:**


* Experience in building and maintaining modern data pipelines with Python, DBT and ETL tools like Airbyte
* Experience with loading and transforming data from various data sources like HubSpot, Google Analytics, RDMS (MySQL, PostgreSQL) and NoSQL databases like DynamoDB and various formats
* Experience with data visualization tooling like Tableau
* Experience with data modeling and data architecture
* Working understanding of software development lifecycles and agile methodologies
* Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to collaborate efficiently in a small data team with a data analyst and medical data scientist
* Excellent English communication skills

**Current tech stack**



We are fully cloud-native utilizing AWS. We adopt a Lean, API first product development approach leveraging cloud technologies and design practices.



Our platform technologies, both microservice and AI, are developed in Python.



We also foster a rapidly growing expertise in knowledge graphs (Neo4j, Memgraph) and database technologies (SQL, NoSQL restful etc.). In addition, we develop human in the loop Machine learning for healthcare in house such as LLMs and other NLP techniques.

 **What we offer**


* Serve a purposeful mission: helping patients gain access to potentially lifesaving treatments
* International work environment, scale-up energy, and flat organization
* Competitive salary, annual performance bonus, and equity
* Great career development opportunities in a growing company
* Learning and development budget, alongside internal knowledge sharing sessions
* Attractive pension plan, full premium covered by us
* Hybrid work model
* Policies to support working parents
* Healthy lunch at the office
* Unlimited access to professional guidance by certified psychologists via OpenUp
* We celebrate freedom every year with an added holiday for Liberation Day on the 5th of May


**Who we are**



myTomorrows aims to break barriers for eligible patients seeking information about clinical trials and support referrals to trial sites. When patients are not eligible for clinical studies, we help them and their physicians to navigate the complexities of expanded access programs.


We are an ambitious, values-driven HealthTech company that empowers patients and physicians to discover and access clinical treatments in development – so tomorrow’s treatments can reach those who need it today. Wherever you are, whichever role you play, you’ll share each & every day with committed, inspired and innovative teammates.



myTomorrows is an Equal Opportunity Employer and, beyond upholding discrimination-free practices, we are committed to cultivating a workplace where difference and diversity are protected and celebrated. The best work comes from our best selves and we go to great lengths in supporting our team members to be just that.



myTomorrows | The Explainer Video
company_description: Het online platform voor versnelde toegang tot nog niet geregistreerde geneesmiddelen.

title: IT & Cyber Risk Specialist
description:
ING is a bank that is known for its IT innovations and has a primarily focus on IT Risk & Security. ING CISO Domestic Bank NL (DBNL) is looking for a passionate and inspiring Non-Financial Risk specialist, who will support the CISO department and the IT organization in the role of IT & Cyber Risk Specialist. You will enable IT senior management to work on IT Risk & Security activities ensuring the ING Market Leader applications and processes for DBNL are and remain safe and compliant.

  

In the function of **IT & Cyber Risk Specialist** your main focus will be to


help the engineering squads and DBNL Tech NL IT Leadership within Market Leaders NL, to improve their way of working with in the IT & Cyber risk area and make a positive impact on their daily work.

**You will fulfill this goal by:**

* Developing and overseeing the implementation of IT-risk and security policies, procedures, and controls within DBNL Tech NL IT domains
* Providing guidance and support on IT-risk and security best practices
* Assisting and advising on IT-risk and security compliance (ITRMP controls, CAS findings, MIAs, vulnerabilities, and other issues)
* Supporting improvement initiatives for various risk areas like Risk automation projects, Automated risk reporting, Tool implementation, etc.
* Implementing various channels for knowledge sharing for IT-risk & security topics
* Supporting with drafting required MIAs / risk acceptance and remediation of IT-risk & control issues and security incidents
* Facilitating IT-risk and security awareness training programs
* Monitoring and reporting on status and progress of IT-risk and security compliance state, issue mitigations, audit findings and other relevant KRI’s/KPI’s
* Keeping track and communicating all changes and updates on risk policies to relevant stakeholders.
* Supporting the engineering squads in maintaining the risk scores on the target levels, where possible reduce and/ or mitigate the various risks
* Prepare, coordinate, document and execute IT SOx audit plans in co-operation with the external auditor
* Inform and support international DevSecOps teams to adhere to IT Risk and SOx requirements
* Cooperate with first- and second-line risk management including coaching of the first line testing team in Bratislava
* Build strong relationship with internal and external stakeholders.

 **Your working Environment:**


In the CISO DBNL department, we take responsibility for IT Risk & Security within Domestic Bank focusing on creating a Safe & Compliant bank.


As IT & Cyber Risk Specialist you will liaise with all levels of defense in ING’s risk model ranging from engineers, management and CISO in the first line, Information Risk Officers and policy makers in the 2nd line to auditors in the 3rd line. You will maintain this relations to build a safe, secure and compliant bank with a detailed focus on IT Risk & Security. ING works in multi-disciplinary teams based on Scrum, Agile and DevOps principles. Responsibility for Infra and Security is adapted within the squads, business & IT have joined, making a squad end-to-end responsible for a customer journey or product. This is also called the ING adaptation of the ‘Spotify’ model. For more about our way of working please visit: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=D3iu2kfZ3w4

**The type of person we are looking for:**

* Inspiring, full of energy and passionate
* Focused on working together, facilitating others within CISO and its stakeholders to be successful
* You don’t take things as granted and you are willing to challenge the status quo
* You have experience and knowledge of IT Risk & Security and its related processes
* You are strong at stakeholder management
* You drive for results and you think in possibilities
* You are constantly looking for improvements
* You are a self-starter and eager to learn and continuous develop yourself in the various Risk areas

 **The skillset you need to have:**

* A University/Postgraduate (Masters) degree in computer science or comparable education
* Certification like CISSP, CISM, CRISC or CISA are a pre
* IT & Security risk management expertise
* Experience with data analytics and visualization tool, such as Power BI is a pre
* People management skills and coaching skills
* Strong analytical skills and critical thinking
* Strong communicational skills
* Strong consulting, negotiating, and presenting skills
* Speaking and writing the English language is a must have

  

ING sets high standards for a high-performing culture, but also for our values according we are working to. These values are defined in the “orange code”. Check out more on: https://www.ing.jobs/Global/Careers/Orange-code.htm

**Rewards and benefits:**


We want to make sure that it’s possible for you to strike the right balance between your career and your private life. You can find out more about our employment conditions at https://www.ing.jobs/netherlands/Why-ING/benefits.htm


The benefits of working with us at ING include:

* 24-27 vacation days depending on the contract
* Pension scheme
* 13th month salary
* Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary
* 8% Holiday payment
* Personal growth and challenging work with endless possibilities
* An informal working environment with innovative colleagues
* Work Agile, so new ideas come to life faster
* 40 hour working week
* An above market average salary depending on experience and expertise
* Entrance to (international) IT events, seminars, courses etc.

 **About us:**


With 60,000 employees and operations in approximately 40 countries, there is no shortage of opportunities for people with initiative who want to help people take a step ahead in life and in business. Do you want to work at the cutting edge of what’s possible and at the same time ensure you work with integrity and hold the customer’s interests at heart? Do you want to be surrounded by progressive, inspiring, diverse and supportive colleagues? Then there is no better place to invest your talents than at ING. Join us and apply today!
company_description: With 9 million account holders, ING is one of the largest and most prominent financial service providers in the Netherlands. We are part of ING Group, a global financial institution.
ceo_name: Steven van Rijswijk, CEO ING Group

title: Technical Data Specialist
description:
IDEXX is looking for a Technical Data Specialist. Price is a key growth driver at IDEXX and pricing data is critical in making strategic decisions. Therefore, the Global CAG Strategic Pricing Team is seeking a Technical Data Specialist to extract, store, automate and visualize pricing data to enhance our decision-making for all things related to CAG product and service pricing.
  
The ideal candidate is highly motivated with strong technical, analytical, and problem-solving skills. This individual will be able to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment and communicate effectively both interpersonally and in written form across functions.
  
Responsibilities will be focused on the technical aspects of managing pricing-related data. Our tech stack includes SAP, SQL, Snowflake, Tableau and Python (desirable).
  
The role involves designing, building, and maintaining data infrastructure and systems to collect, store, and process pricing data efficiently. You will work closely with the Global pricing team and business stakeholders to understand data requirements, develop data pipelines, and ensure data quality and integrity. Additionally, you will automate data processes, and integrate pricing data with other business systems. Your work will enable the organization to leverage pricing data effectively for strategic decision-making and competitive advantage.
  
  

In this role
  
You will be using multiple systems, you will take ownership to create, organize, validate, develop, reconcile, and maintain pricing datasets for analysis to be used by the Global pricing and FP&A teams, whilst improving data quality, consistency, and efficiency.
  
You will build an inventory of pricing data needed to implement the architecture and create a vision for how pricing data will flow through the organization.
  
You will strive continuously to improve pricing data for predictive modelling.
  
You will develop and maintain scalable technical reporting solutions and create dashboards in chosen reporting tools to be able to communicate findings and provide visibility to stakeholders.
  
You will support in producing and developing appropriate monitoring for pricing.
  
You will collaborate with stakeholders to identify and address pricing data-related needs.
  
You will proactively identify and troubleshoot performance bottlenecks and pricing data integrity issues.
  
You will develop, maintain, and optimize data visualization and dashboard designs.
  
You will create and maintain documentation for data processes and reporting guides.
  
You will provide ongoing maintenance and process improvements for pricing data initiatives.
  
  

What you need to succeed
  
You are proficient in writing queries in programming languages such as Structured Query Language (SQL) and Python is a plus to have.
  
You have good experience with relational databases such as SAP and Snowflake.
  
You have experience with data visualisation and dashboard design best practices, preferable using tableau.
  
You have a good understanding of data quality, processing, and data visualization principles.
  
You have strong data manipulation skills, and advanced excel would be beneficial.
  
You have a natural curiosity and excellent data-gathering, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
  
You can translate high-level business requirements into technical solutions and actionable insights.
  
You have experience in designing and maintaining business reports.
  
You can demonstrate high levels of problem-solving skills & initiative whilst working to tight deadlines.
  
You can function in a fast-paced high energy environment.
  
You have good written and verbal communication skills and can communicate technical content to diverse audiences.
  
You excel at planning and organizing your work and can prioritize and be flexible with changing business needs.
  
You are a self-starter and can work independently with minimal guidance, as well as in a team.
  
You have initiative to improve documentation and support pricing processes.
  
Pricing experience is not required
  
  

Why IDEXX
  
We’re proud of the work we do because our work matters. An innovation leader in every industry we serve, we follow our Purpose and Guiding Principles to help pet owners worldwide keep their companion animals health and happy, to ensure safe drinking water for billions, and to help farmers protect livestock and poultry from disease. We have customers in over 175 countries and a global workforce of over 11,000 talented people.
  
So, what does that mean for you? We enrich livelihoods of our employees with a positive and respectful work culture that embraces challenges and encourages learning and discovery. At IDEXX, you will be supported by competitive compensation, incentives and benefits while enjoying purposeful work that drives improvement.
  
Let’s pursue what matters together!
  
IDEXX values a diverse workforce and workplace and strongly encourages women, people of color, LGBT individuals, people with disabilities, members of ethnic minorities, foreign-born residents, and veterans to apply. IDEXX is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will not be discriminated against because of race, color, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, religion, national origin, citizenship status, disability, ancestry, marital status, veteran status, medical condition, or any protected category prohibited by local, state, or federal laws.
company_description: 10,000 people, one global focus Enhancing the health and well-being of pets, people, and livestock.
ceo_name: Jay Mazelsky President and Chief Executive Officer

title: Data Engineer
description:
As a Data Visualization Engineer at Profitap you will take part in the development of our detailed traffic analysis visualizations.

  


You will be working closely with our software development team and our network engineers, you will have the opportunity to shape the user experience for our solutions. This position will give you the opportunity to explore and learn more about how network traffic data can be used to monitor and troubleshoot complex computer networks.

  

Our solutions need highly performant, user-friendly, and designed following the latest technical standards. With over 1,100 clients from over 70 countries, you can work in an international environment and contribute to better network visibility and analytics on all traffic across physical and virtual infrastructures globally.

 **You and your skills:**


* You have proven experience in Grafana dashboard development and data visualization
* You have strong proficiency with SQL and experience with ClickHouse or similar database management systems
* You have xperience optimizing SQL queries for data analysis and reporting is a plus
* You have solid understanding of data structures and database schema design
* You have excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
* You have strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment


**You will be a perfect match if:**


* You have experience with Git version control
* Experience with GNU/Linux is a plus


**You share our core values:**


* Refreshing: we’re always open to new ideas
* Bold: we’re not afraid to test and learn new things
* Reliable: we’re proud of our track record of developing reliable solutions
* Diverse: we have a multicultural team with more than ten nationalities


**Benefits**

  

* You will be working in an internationally oriented, fast-growing, high-tech company


* Ability to develop unique products with the latest technologies


* Hybrid position – with a minimum of 3 days at the office


* A good salary that grows with the company and your accomplishments


* Travel allowance
* Training budget to improve your skills


* Holiday package that includes your birthday off
* Extra holidays based on your years of employment within our company


* A year-end bonus


* Discount on a health insurance

 **About Profitap:**

  


Profitap is a Dutch manufacturer of cutting-edge network monitoring solutions. We have been in business for over 30 years and have built a strong track record in an international niche market with a strong multicultural team. Thanks to that growth and development, our R&D department is actively looking for new talent to join us at the High Tech Campus in Eindhoven

  

**To apply, please send your CV and cover letter in English to recruit@profitap.com.**



Don’t hesitate to contact us in case you have any further questions. We reserve the right to contact chosen candidates only.

 **Acquisition in response to this vacancy is not appreciated nor processed.**

title: Delivery Leader
description:
**As a Delivery Leader focused on Measurement, Evaluation and Digital, you’ll work with leaders in the public sector (government, philanthropy, non-profits) to define their theory of change, build and operate systems for collecting the right data, and assess and evaluate programs to generate evidence that will drive greater impact in their work.**


 DA works closely with governments at every level, all over the world, to implement policy in a way that translates to real outcomes for everyday people. We do the same for foundations and social impact organizations, helping turn innovative programs into lasting impact. **In short, we help public sector partners get things done.** We use a clear methodology to solve problems and help our partners deliver results. We’re successful in part because we master our approach and in part because we are empathetic, resourceful, level-headed, and dedicated to our clients and the people they serve.

**Skill sets.**


We work closely in diverse, global teams, leaning on each other’s strengths. We don’t expect any one person to do all these things perfectly. Our teams are made up of people who can:

* **Build relationships:** Earn trust and influence among diverse stakeholders, especially in the public sector or nonprofit world.
* **Facilitate and coach:** Run effective meetings and workshops that drive towards problem solving and consensus.
* **Collect, manage and analyze raw data** to extract actionable insights and recommendations and visualize it for decision making.
* **Model data to identify patterns and forecast future trends:** Utilize advanced analytical and statistical techniques and tools to reveal relationships within datasets, enabling prediction of outcomes and informed decision-making
* **Write, visualize and communicate clearly:** Turn complex problems or insights into clear memos and well-structured slides; speak clearly and concisely in remote and in-person settings. Be able to simplify complexity, translating technical language into digestible narratives that enable great decision making of different audiences.
* **Prioritize and manage projects:** Bring clear structure and planning to day-to-day work and communication.
* **Solve problems:** Break down problems and identify root causes before developing hypotheses and solutions.
* **Stay focused:** Navigate complexity, especially in policy and program implementation, consistently steering large coalitions back to a single-minded focus on priority outcomes.

**Mindsets.**


We work well with people that are:

* **Adaptable**: Public sector work is dynamic. Our people are, too.
* **Analytical:** We identify, dissect, and solve complex problems.
* **Accountable**: We are a remote team. We work collaboratively but self-sufficiently; oversight is often minimal.
* **Driven:** Our work is important, so it’s important we do it well.
* **Curious:** We never stop learning from our clients, colleagues, and partners.

**Experience.**


Many of our people have backgrounds in management consulting, public sector implementation, government, philanthropy, non-profits, think tanks / policy research, and international development. Some come from startups and tech. Most have some experience with our major verticals: education, public health, sustainability, economic development, agriculture. But we’ve done this long enough to know that what matters most is your skill set and your mindset. We’re open to lots of backgrounds as long as you can show us you’re an analytical thinker, a clear communicator, a team player, and an avid learner.

**Required Skills/Experience:**


These are the basics.

* Bachelor’s degree
* A minimum of 3 years of relevant, full time work experience in government, consulting, public policy, or tech; previous economics, evaluation, or data scientist experience ideal
* Quantitative analysis skills, demonstrated experience with statistics, econometrics and/or data science techniques and practices
* Knowledge of Excel and Google Sheets required; knowledge of programming/econometrics software (R, Python, Stata, etc.) and/or visualization platforms (Tableau, Power BI), preferred.
* Knowledge of data warehousing solutions, big data, machine learning and/or the use of artificial intelligence (AI) tools for data processing
* Business-level English skills
* Must be based in and have work authorization in the United States. Delivery Associates will not sponsor applicants for work visas.

**What We Offer:**

* Exposure to senior leaders in government, NGOs and other social impact organizations
* Opportunity to be part of a growing team working on transformative projects in all continents
* Opportunity to shape the future trajectory of a fast-growing firm and grow with it
* Competitive compensation and benefits
* 25-50% travel

**About Delivery Associates**


We help governments and social impact organizations all over the world turn big ideas, campaign promises, and ambitious goals into everyday reality for the people they serve. We approach every problem with a strong bias towards implementation, an open mind to possibilities, empathy for governments and residents, and a strong values system that helps us harness our capabilities to make change happen.

title: Market intelligence analyst
description:
In this role, you will be central to producing high-quality insights and foresights to our customers to support strategy execution and development. The insights are delivered to our customers through our Market Intelligence platform and in quarterly and yearly sessions in which you will have a big role.


Do you enjoy and enjoy translating data into actionable insights and foresights? Read on!

##### **What You'll Be Doing:**

* Analyze diverse data sources such as annual reports and trade databases to uncover key trends that inform strategic decisions.
* Ensure the highest data accuracy and continuously enhance our insight generation processes.
* Use your expertise to forecast trends and integrate foresights into client strategies, guiding their decision-making.
* Simplify complex data into actionable insights during workshops and client presentations, influencing strategic directions.
* Craft intuitive models and visualizations that support data-driven decisions for our team and clients.

###### **Projects You’ll Work On:**

* **Market Assessments:** Assess the market potential for key segments within large agricultural and food companies, leveraging both public and proprietary data to support strategic planning and investment decisions.
* **Competitive Benchmarking:** Conduct in-depth competitive reviews for major food customers, synthesizing data into strategic recommendations that are presented to senior management.

###### **What Success Looks Like:**

* **First 30 Days:** Familiarize yourself with our company culture, data systems, and client profiles to effectively integrate into our team.
* **First 90 Days:** Enhance your skills to actively engage in and contribute to quarterly customer discussions, aligning your efforts with our strategic goals.
* **First 180 Days:** Take charge of preparing content for customer workshops and leading project workstreams in market and competitor analysis, showcasing your growing independence and expertise.

###### **Challenges:**

* **Data Management:** Process and refine extensive datasets efficiently to maintain data integrity and ensure the insights generated are actionable.
* **Learning Curve:** Quickly adapt to the complexities of our operational and analytical tools, becoming proficient in their use.

###### **Key Performance Indicators (KPIs):**

* **Insight Quality:** Measure the effectiveness of insights through customer feedback and their impact on client decision-making processes.


‍


‍

##### **Your Talent:**

* An independent thinker with a strong analytical mindset, eager to take on challenges and drive results.
* Strong communication skills, capable of explaining complex data in understandable terms.
* Skilled in Excel, experience with visualization tools and data analytics tools is a pré (Python, Power BI, and SQL).
* Proven ability to handle complex datasets and generate meaningful business insights.
* The ideal candidate will likely have between 2 to 5 years of experience, and a degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics or similar fields.


‍

##### **Who you'll be working with:**


Miriam
Head of Insights & Strategic Services
Mathieu
Associate
Jurre
Junior Analyst##### **What We Offer:**

* A competitive salary range of €47,000 - €60,000 annually, which includes an 8% holiday bonus.
* Performance bonus of up to 10% of your gross salary.
* A hybrid work setup where you can balance working from home with 2-5 days in the office per week.
* Regular company events like dinners, BBQs, boat trips, and padel tournaments, fostering a vibrant team culture.
##### **About A-INSIGHTS**


A-INSIGHTS is the fastest growing company and market intelligence platform in the market. Trusted and loved by some of the world's largest companies (Bayer, McCain, Ahold, RoyalFrieslandCampina, Gemeente Amsterdam), we combine worldwide publicly available company and market data with the latest domain & tech expertise.


Our goal is to set the international standard for objective company performance insights based on publicly available data.


And our journey is just getting started!


Every day, we make it easy for organizations around the world to make a difference through best-in-class insights and unmatched service. And we don’t plan on stopping anytime soon.


We are building a team of passionate and talented people who are eager to contribute to this growth and help us write our story.

##### **Application Process:**

* **Screening Call:** Kick off your application with a screening call from our recruiter to discuss your background and fit for the role.
* **Online Skill-Based Assessment**
* **In-Person Interview:** If successful in the initial stages, you'll be invited to our Amsterdam office for an in-depth interview to further assess your fit with our team and culture.

###### **Ready to Apply?**

*If this role excites you, don't hesitate—apply today via our careers page! Research indicates that some groups, particularly women, are less likely to apply for jobs unless they meet every qualification. If you're passionate about joining us but don't meet all the criteria, we still encourage you to apply. We're excited to see how your unique skills might contribute to our team at A-INSIGHTS.*

**Have Questions?** For any inquiries or additional information, please contact Iselde van Beurden, Interim Talent Lead, at:

* Email: Iselde@theentrepreneurials.com
* Whatsapp: +31 (0)638276027
Got questions about this job?
If you have any questions, you can always contact Mathieu Geuskens at mathieu.geuskens@a-insights.eu

title: Data Scientist
description:
Do you want to make impact in our digital transformation within Supply Chain? We have an opportunity for you as an Enterprise Data Scientist in our Global Digital Supply Chain team.

  


Wat we vragen


* Can do mentality, hands-on, challenging the current state, growth mindset, persistent, emphatic
* You have a broader view than just your position and you can identify with our purpose ‘Nourishing by Nature’.
* You are customer focused and are able to act with speed and decisiveness to achieve the best results.
* You take responsibility for your work and are continuously looking for new opportunities to make a change.
* Bachelor/Master education or equivalent.
* +4 years of experience as Data Scientis or in a similar role;
* Experienced knowledge in other related field such as statistics, math, computer science, or economics.
* Experience working with supply chain data and systems
* Knowledge of statistical techniques and data visualization tools.
* Analytical skills and proficiency in data wrangling and analysis tools such as SQL, PowerBI, and Excel
* Conceptual thinker, focusing on next step, next gen
* Internationally oriented and excellent communication and influencing skills;
* Capabilities in Project/Portfolio Management
* Capable of effective stakeholder management at various levels within RFC;


Wat we bieden


* Unique company culture of Dutch heritage and international presence
* We offer great work life balance, and competitive salary & benefits package so you can enjoy it
* Workweek of 38 hours, competitive pension scheme, holiday allowance of 8%, end year allowance 4%, bonus scheme, flexible working hours and the ability to work from home.
* Diverse training and mentoring programs to help you grow on your own professional journey
* Exceptional support of cross disciplinary movement within the company to broaden your knowledge and growth paths
* A friendly and informal working environment, yet professional team members as sparring partners
* Autonomy and trust to create longer term impact that helps bring better nutrition to the world
* Free cheese and milk at lunch in the central office, and barista coffee to help you go through your working days with a lot of joy


Vacaturetekst
We are looking for an Enterprise Data scientist in our Digital Supply Chain Team. In this role you:

* Develop digital tools for our business to enable improvements of our business
* Operate in a challenging landscape of End-to-End Supply chain while tasked to optimize, simplify and standardize our processes by digitalization.
* Use your analytical and statistical methods to identify patterns, trends, and insights from data that can be used to improve business performance.


You will be part of our Global Digital Supply Chain team, consisting of ten teammembers. The purpose of this team of to effectively leverage the power of digital capabilities and solutions to improve Service, Cost and Cash in the Global and End-to-End Supply Chain.
